N1n7iZSwaGrbVijWmv0liA.text: Oh farfegnugen!  Alright - I have no idea what that means but it was a good night at the ole Hofbrau.  I ended up taking my engineers who were craving some German Food.    We put on our best yard gnome attire (atleast that is what it reminds me when I see shorts and suspenders) and took the drive down to Hofbrau.  We were quickly seated.    There was a gentleman who was quite good playing the keyboard and interacting with the crowd.   Many people were doing what appeared to be Ski Shots (shots done with a group that were on a ski).    Please note - if you are the shortest person in your group - you will tend to get wet.    I don't know why but what you think will be a casual shot will end up being a silly experience out of Nickelodeon.  The restaurant was not filled to capacity by no means but we had to wait 15 minutes before we were asked for our first beers.   In the waitress defense, she had 2 large tables.   After we received our first beer and put in our appetizer order we did not care.  Appetizer - I order the team the works - potato cakes, fried pickles, sauerkraut balls, and pretzels.   It was good but nothing to write home about.  Dinner - Bavarian Jagerschnitzel  a pan seared Pork Cutlet topped with a Burgundy Wine Mushroom and Bacon Sauce with Bacon Slices served with Cranberry Sauce, German Potato Salad and Chef 's Vegetable Selection.  My dinner was very good.   The pork was cooked perfectly, the sauce was tasty, and bacon will always be the perfect meat candy to any meal.  The Beer - I had the Oktoberfest beer (limited time) and Lager.  The beer at Hofbrau is always pretty good.  If you are in a group - this is the place to go.  I will be back but there are many local places I would rather go to in comparison - thus the three stars.   There is nothing wrong with the place - I am sure I will be back.

aCZRX-A9GYBPC0gLZl9xbw.text: Awesome Sauerbraten. Simply put this is a great place with great food. Good beer and wonderful staff. This is my second time here and if I lived in Pittsburgh I'd be a regular. It's worth driving 50 miles for. The strudel is straight from Germany and worth saving room for. Get the vanilla bean ice cream and you'll be happy.  If your only here for a day, eat here. Unless you just flew in from Germany.

oEl5sehuNJIsPSCHUQQtFg.text: Go here with a group of friends because it's a party place. The food is great, German bier garden fare. Limited number of selections on tap, but I guess that is on point for a German bier garden. Did I mention drunk ladies dancing on the table to the house band playing Journey songs?

J1OhcAq2XNVkwtgfaCW94A.text: Great beer!  Worst service I've seen in a while.  Will be calling the GM on Monday.  I'm too old to be treated like I'm in a college bar.    I would IMMEDIATELY ask Alexander if he wants to even be employed there.  Then start his new hire orientation again.    He wasn't the only bad apple.....just only name I collected and the worst offender.  Maybe it's his manager's fault?

A5Oiu03m4k29Y7eM9JEZHA.text: Brought my family (group of 9) here for a nice dinner on the patio- great idea! They can accommodate large groups and there is plenty of beer to go around! The atmosphere is True to what you would find over in Germany- loud and boisterous! If you're not into loud music and chanting- sit on the patio- you'll be glad you did! The view is spectacular!  The food was also nice- ordered schnitzel sandwich and potato pancakes.

W_B5LjCf4a1i5Krn4fIM2Q.text: Amazing food and atmosphere. A very jolly place that is loud and robust and an overall great experience. The food is delicious and the beer is unique and delicious. A bit pricey and hectic but absolutely fun!

pKdZzMyqiRn2gMcNrwTGng.text: A great German beer hall. The food is authentic, but they have selections for the people who are not fans of German food. Had the sausage meal, it game with 3 different types of sausage, mashed potatoes and sauerkraut. A meal that very filling and at a great price. The giant soft pretzel comes with 3 dips, cheese, stone ground mustard and a horseradish sauce. Atmosphere was very "polka friendly" with live music. I hear that it gets a little rowdy at late night. Well worth the visit !

VN3BbIkFd80lEaWTWB_5Tw.text: Great food, great atmosphere and yummy beer. We took our three young kids who really enjoyed the love music (yodeling!) , soft pretzels and bier cheese . My husband and i also both adored our meals. I wish I could remember what they were. He had a sausage sampler. I had the fried pork with ham and bier cheese. Yuuuuuuuuuuuuum!! We're from out of town but wish we could come here all of the time!!!

R8aZk9CKn5wRNatjzVXNGQ.text: I have a like/dislike relationship with this place. It is great if you are freshly 21 and/or are in college or are in party mode. The food is nothing special, the drinks are huge, and it is just one big singing/drinking party. The live entertainment they had was drinking beer whilst they were singing and...it got interesting.

yMgG9c9H-9BCqeIY4HHEFg.text: Another e-mail not answered about parking validation options to offset the cost of valet parking.   So, you know what? I'm tired of paying for parking. The food isn't much (except for the potato soup, and I enjoy many beers and wines found elsewhere.   Probably will never visit Hofbrauhaus again.   Valet costs plus tip equals two craft beers somewhere else with free parking.   Good bye Hofbrauhaus. I enjoyed you in Munich in the '60's, can live without  you now.

JnxDk4vgP-fW652II9CdvQ.text: This restaurant is very nice. The staff was very friendly and service was great. The food is delicious and there is a great selection of beer. Definitely loved the music and how everyone was dressed.

IK_vHt-Rz1pW0YovIXMPBQ.text: My family and I were looking for a fun place to go for our last night out before I went to college, and we decided on the Hofbrauhaus.  It was a great decision.  We got the Giant Pretzel and sausage platter for a starter.  Both were delicious.  The sauerkraut that came with the sausage was soooo good.  I made sure I got a side of kraut with my meal because of it.  The Pretzel was great too, and the sauces were phenomenal.  For my meal I got the pork.  The one i ordered was the Bavarian Jaugersniztwel.  It had mushrooms and bacon on top, and the sauce with it was absolutely great.  The sides were also good.  The waiter told me before that the veggies were frozen and not good, but I ordered them anyways, and I really enjoyed them.  The workers messed up my mothers sides, but they fixed it with no problems at all, and within sixty seconds, we had the new sides.  We even got to keep the wrong sides, which I was very happy to devour.    Everybody at the table liked their meals, and we even had enough room to throw down some apple strudel and chocolate cake.  They were both delicious.  I would defiantly recommend this place.  The atmosphere is beyond fun, and if I am excited for two birthdays from now when I get to spend my 21st Bday cheers-ing German beers and singing along with the rest of the place.

jdGnskP1siOicYBwTnsPWw.text: Hofbrauhaus Pretzels And Bier Cheese / Soft Dough Pretzels + Bier Cheese Spatzle + June - Leichtes Weizen = two thumbs up! I've been here twice. FYI: loud audible music if you sit inside - in the main area (if you're into that) though pretty nice outdoor seating.

C5eNhf_Y4UCPuZv9dqMR5g.text: Good food, beer land music. As authentic as you're going to get in the U.S. I recommend keeping it simple. Get a beer and some pretzels and call it a day. Maybe a side of sauerkraut too.

kAQSjg01hiR5R83InjEF9w.text: It was love at first sip! The Hafbru Hefe Weizen is my favorite beer here. I've never been a big fan of banana flavor until I enjoyed this beer. The banana flavor is distinct but not over powering. The hint of clover brings about a balance that allows this beer to not be too sweet. This is a savoring beer. Kick back and enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Hofbrauhaus Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Hefe Weizen!

8XALBDTHZ2H6wPQs_meVKA.text: So even before moving back to Pittsburgh in October of 2010, I had the opportunity to experience the Hofbrauhaus... and I did not like it then.  So since I moved within a stones throw of the place, I have decided to give it many a chances to wow me in some regard to make me like it and want to come back (I mean, for the sake of convenience, it would be an ideal place to like more than we do).  After numerous attempts at at least liking it enough to come back once a month, I cannot even do that.    The main hall is obnoxious.... I guess I am getting old as I cannot stand how loud it is and it always baffles me how many smaller children and babies are there with their families... especially since I have seen people get rowdy at times.    The only way I will be back is outside in the warmer weather... I like to avoid the aforementioned hoopla.    The food (minus some of the apps) leaves little to be desired in my opinion.  With so many other better dining options in town, this is not somewhere I will go for a full meal.    Service is hit or miss... I often seemed to have more luck at the bar than dealing with a server.    The beer is good... and the prices are good as well for the quantities.... so I guess that should help improve the rating to at least three stars (that coupled with the beer garden).

deZJXZkBaxwgbLqRw9JLGA.text: I must say that this place was very enjoyable... We came here around noon on a Monday to find the place pretty empty, but I have a lot of German heritage, so I am having sausage and beers!  I got two sausages with a soft pretzel (off the lunch menu, see photo) and they were AMAZING! Even the mustard that came on the side was good, and I hate that crap most of the time! I also ordered the Hofbrau Hofbrau Dunkel beer (see photo), a 5.5 by volume. It had a nice full flavor, not to heavy and because it was made there it makes it just a little extra special...  We also had a pork sandwich on the table, a potato pancake, and a veggie burger... The fries are worth mentioning as well... VERY good!  I would love to come here on a weekend to sing and drink with a big crowd, but that didn't happen this go around. If I was ever in the area again, I will defiantly come back!

MbDyhEg1yhedyFwJDg7Xtw.text: Are you kidding me? THIS PLACE IS AWESOME. I thought I was dreaming, but when I woke up in a bier cheese stained shirt, sore legs from dancing on tables, and had the smell of beer on my breath - I knew that I had in fact experienced heaven.   Unfortunately though, I awoke still not having a clue as to who the f*** Alice is. And that's ok with me because I will be back a million times more to chant her name anyway.

qxi0eLXW43mP7YHHQpYTyQ.text: Hofbrauhaus is a great spot to spend a night out. The highlight is the freshly brewed beer served by the liter at quite reasonable prices. I forget exactly how much a liter is, but it's less than $10, which is a steal for beer of this quality. All the beers are spot on, I've never sampled any of the food but it seems great for drunk munchies. Service is friendly and fairly efficient, even on crowded nights.  The crowd varies from rowdy college students to tamer, older groups, but it's never unpleasant and there's always seats to be had if you don't feel like standing with your beer. The outdoor area is lively yet relaxing during the summer, there's nothing quite like enjoying a stein (or three) looking out at the river and skyline.

HTNIdcGa07lruprmVneK7Q.text: Strictly from a tourist's perspective, I think Hofbrauhaus is excellent. I can see how for locals, it might get on your nerves a bit, but as an out-of-towner, this place hit the spot.   We went there twice (embarrassing?) - the first time on a weekend night. The outdoor seating in the back was perfect for drinks and pretzels/beer cheese. We were there for a few hours, and it was relatively uncrowded (although it's huge, so there were probably a lot of people there). People really do stand on benches and sing along with the band in the inside area, but if you are looking to spend time in a place where you can hear yourself talk, the beer garden was perfect.   We went back the next day for lunch, mostly because we loved the beer (the Oktoberfest is delicious) and we wanted to sit outside with a view of the river.  The food was heavy, probably not ideal for a hot summer day, but the rest of the experience was great.   The whole thing is a little kitschy, what with the "authentic" (?) Bavarian outfits donned by the serving staff and the accordion player strolling around the joint. And there was a significant influx of college age club-hoppers getting their night started. Also be prepared to get ID'd at every corner regardless of your age. But honestly, none of those factors affected our experience at all - we even bought a souvenir Hofbrauhaus mug to take home.

iTHWZuK4GthL1H_jHZqBmA.text: I've never had german food before so I have nothing with which to gauge my meal. However I will try to provide an accurate rundown.  We sat in the bier garden outside which has a wonderful view of the river. I'd never been to a bier garden before and it appeared to just be an outdoor area with picnic tables where you eat and drink. Excellent. I am a fan of outdoor dining.  They brew their own beer here and have several options they offer year round such as their premium beer, a light beer and a hefeweizen...they also have a seasonal beer each month.  The beers come in two sizes 1/2 Liter or 1 Liter.  We started off with the fries with bier cheese and bacon, which was so delicious!  For my meal I got the jager schnitzel which was basically a fried porkchop in gravy served with german potato salad and some veggies. After tasting the food here I see why the beers can afford to be so large. Everything was so dense, but I guess that's what german food is.  Overall this is a fun restaurant which seems like a place I would enjoy best just for some heavy appetizers and huge beers with some friends. So if your ever in the Pittsburgh area you should go! You'll have a good time.

EMxvxNP-M0Py28Kz0Om_cQ.text: I went to Hofbrauhaus on a Thursday night... There was a one man German "band" playing throughout the night who was fantastic!  He not only sang German drinking songs but he entertained us with dancing music and even Russian music.  There was a nice little dance floor in front of the stage where my friends and I danced the night away... of course we sat down for the meal.  We had the potato pancakes... which were much better than the potato pancakes at another German restaurant in Pittsburgh called Penn Brewery.  I also got schwinenbraten (excuse my poor spelling).  I substituted the sauerkraut for apple kraut... a very good decision.  And had a pretty good bread dumpling.    I went to Germany last summer and experienced my boyfriends' family's homemade German cooking... so nothing really compares to that.... but the food was pretty good... I'd say about a 3.5 or 4 depending on what you order.  But the experience made the night a 5 for sure!  I also recommend ordering a liter to really make the experience authentic... if you're not a fan of beer (such as me) order a radler.  It's typically half lemonade and half beer.. but this restaurant offers that choice or half sprite, half beer.  It's quite good and allows even the non-beer drinkers the chance to join in the beer song fun!  In conclusion, go to Hofbrauhaus.... go with a group (ideally 4 or more) you'll have a blast if you're not afraid to join in the singing and dancing.

pBHnMX1N-bWx_L9NfysskA.text: 2 Words:  Awesome Beer.  It had to be the best place in town to watch the Olympics that night.  The atmosphere was superb.  Everyone was singing along with the band while standing on there chairs (with beer in hand).  This experience has added Hofbrauhaus to my list of places to visit when I go to Munich.

RBs-VVDDS44qjOKw2zbR8w.text: Hofbrauhaus is a phenominal place to go when you have a group of people with you.  The prices are fair for the food which is Bavarian styled.  I sat in the beer hall when I was there.  Service and food were great.  This chain even brews their own beer on site and you can get it either in a liter or 1/2L.  Seasonal offerings are superb, even if some you can only get in 1/2L.

2-Mrk2ZaOWYQ07yuLI-ZuQ.text: This is no more an authentic beer hall than the Tiki Lounge is an authentic Polynesian hut.  But the inside atmosphere is fun and energetic, with people dancing on tables as the band plays polkaized versions of Neil Diamond songs.  It is very very loud, with open seating after 9pm on weekends, so don't expect to have any conversations.  The outside is more chill and is a nice spot to sit along the river.  That said, the two stars are strictly for atmosphere only.  After 30 minutes of sitting outside went by with no one taking our orders, we had to chase down a waitress.  The beers are not-so-good.  The wheat is the only decent beer in the lot.  Instead of beers, I'd order a shotski--four shot glasses attached to a ski so all drinkers are forced to take shots in unison...Any shot you can imagine.  As far as the food goes, if you're not getting a pretzel, you'll be disappointed.  That's the only great item on the menu.  The sauerkraut is just awful.    The doormen here take their jobs too seriously.  I was startled by two of them yelling "thief" at me after I walked out with my group of co-workers.  Everyone around stopped to stare.  After the doormen said people had been stealing glasses, I showed them my left-overs from dinner were the bugle in my handbag.  The funny part is that I was stone-sober and didn't even order a drink there, so had no glass to steal.  I would have been willing to forgive and forget, but I never got an apology.  So I docked a star for poor service.

ADl6Whxz6dS_iZG7HYa3Ag.text: I had my first beer ever here at Hofbrauhaus! I love the atmosphere of the expansive beer hall. Live music was fun, and who doesn't want to clank mugs of beer together while standing on tables? It does get very busy late night and service can get slow, but it's all part of the experience :-) I highly recommend this place; don't leave without having the pretzels and a shotski!

voSeZq9UwBeWA13SmD7jxw.text: The beer garden here is simply AWESOME.  They just do it right, great place to enjoy a big beer on a warm night.  Kind of out of the way, but come right in, down the stairs, and enjoy!

Uo8Prz4NHpQ2-JhYg9aJ3g.text: I have been there several times and I love this place. The German food is excellent and the Dunkel beer is awesome. The biergarten is a great place to hang out and have a drink right next to the river. I highly recommend the Hofbrauhaus.

YLyF6heMn-2U5sRo3OW39g.text: The food was excellent.  The entertainment played our two favorite German songs back to back.  The manager opened up the gift shop for us to buy souviniers even though it was closed. Would definately go there again.

wdEQfLxkISZbw4bjHgZJrg.text: This place is awesome! So much fun. I went for the first time on my birthday recently and had a blast! It's like a huge party/smorgasbord. Neato German looking guy singing up front and calling out the shot-ski's!!! Shot-skis are so fun! (kinda expensive but well worth it). This is a great place to have tons of fun with a whole room of friends and people you will meet for the first time! Loads of fun, Great beer and food!!

ClGgyIOqU2_R8YggDsGEqQ.text: Big beer steins.  Delicious beer.  Sing-a-long drinking bands.  What more could you ask for?

NIKeDxKkwIEQtrrbAVbcew.text: We have been here several times for the atmosphere-which is one-of-a-kind but just recently had dinner here. The german potato salad was excellent! We shared the platter of pork chops, brats, sauerkraut, & potatoes and for 2 people it was more than enough food-we couldn't finish it all! They also have the live german music playing in the main dining hall. After dinner, be sure to go onto the outdoor patio area and take in the great views of the river & city.

7NOWMzfNvsjV6HahmPAYIQ.text: This place was great and is super large inside as well as outside. We sat on the Terrace which has a covering in case for rain. The garden area as closed while we were there due to weather.  We tried the appetizer sampler and the Bavarian Sampler for 2 to split with 4 people. Both dishes were plenty of food. Appetizers  - Fried Pickles - I still haven't found one that I like. Sauerkraut Balls - they look like mini hush puppies with cabbage and ham inside.  Potato Pancake - texture is nothing like a pancake but looks like a fritter. Tasty. Pretzels - nothing special Sampler - Smoked pork chop is SALTY. Bleh! Sausages are delicious - though Hot Dog consistency. Schweinsbraten or roast pork - nothing special though I must say it was the healthiest of what was on the plate Strudel - Not sure if this is authentic but the strudel lacked any crisp to it and it was soggy and sad. I would not order this again. Beer - Buying 1 liter of Beer to get a glass is crap - almost twice as expensive as just getting the beer alone.

h1RHUt-vBx93j-uc-VL8RQ.text: I absolutely love the environment in this place. People go here to be loud and have fun. The outside seating is great and the big hall is s great experience.   If you want to hold a conversation with people and chit-chat...not the place for you.   Beer: I just ordered one without asking questions first...mistake, maybe the first time in my life I ordered a beer and just refused to drink it. I learned after that they have a sampler, if you are not sure, try the sampler first. It will save you some trouble.   So my review for this place is mixed, IF you are looking for a loud place where people are having a good time with good food, do it, I just caution you to sample the beers before ordering a whole stein.

4tH8L1x9PHpVp9W_yEfiBA.text: The wife & I were in town for a concert and our friend recommended this place. We arrived on Saturday, shortly after they opened at 11:00. There was only one party ahead of us in the entire place.  The restaurant resembles a German bier haus, which my wife & I loved.  Waitress was very nice. We started with the beer sampler, five beers for $6.95. The beer is okay, nothing to brag about. We enjoyed the Octoberfest beer and the Dunkel.  We moved on to the sauerkraut balls. These things were awesome. If you are not offended by sauerkraut, you must try these. I then ordered the Hofbrauhaus Wurstlplatte and substituted sauerkraut for regular spaetzle. This is my third German restaurant and I finally found out the right way, how spaetzle is supposed to taste. The sausage was all very good. The wife got the Schnitzel Weiner Art.  The portion was huge so I was able to steal some of her food and it was fantastic. This place is great and cannot wait to return. We came for Judas Priest but loved the Hofbrauhaus...

pJ38n7PNDNSbFYicNt6mJA.text: This place is great. The food is fantastic, yum yum yumz.  The beer is also great, I got wasted with my grandma and my parents. Doesn't get much better than that. This is a place that people of any age can have a good time because it's such a drunk shit show.  Only downside is how crowded it tends to get. I had a friend that worked here and managed to get us a seat after like 20 minutes but for the most part people were waiting for at least an hour for a table.  Do it!

OKfFyr4nIXWhwC2rPy3cPA.text: It turns out I didn't need my 1 year of German to enjoy my evening here.   While I've never been to Germany (does a layover in Munich count) or a beer garden, I'm always looking for new places to try out when I'm in Pittsburgh.  My friend promised me that there would be lots of beer and boys, and that was all I needed to go.    We arrived on a Friday evening sometime after 9 and it was jam packed with people of all ages toting mugs of beer that were in some cases larger than their heads.  The only food we snacked on was the pretzels and beer cheese dip, which was really good.  Beer, not sure if it was locally brewed or imported, well it was fine but nothing to write home.  The band seemed to take a lot of breaks, but they were entertaining when they were performing.  Smart space.  I'm glad that restaurants are finally wising up and taking advantage of the terrific river front and opening up spaces for outdoor seating, which can be enjoyed a fair portion of the year.   I hope for the massive size of the place that the owners will find ways to prolong the novelty and that it stays open for a long time.  I agree with other reviews that it's best enjoyed with a large group of friends.  Probably not likely that I would return on a future trip.  I'm not sure if its the women scantily clad in Forever 21 dancing on the long wooden benches or the triple and quad shots of Jaeger served from a ski, but the experience didn't feel very authentic and it's not really my thing.

jYOIemUfqpmURqOVJ8tUlQ.text: Undoubtedly the best lager I have had in years.  The assorted appetizers are freshly made and delicious.  The interior definitely resembles a German beer hall (namely the original Hofbrauhas in Munich), although the house band could use more lessons.  Eins, zwei, g'suffa !

FEKYEJvANbkpdAQC-QUnIg.text: I joined a group here for food and drinks.   I must say that I am a huge fan of German food and culture before I say this is a great place to eat or meet with friends for some beers. The place is huge and on the river with an expansive patio in the back. Unless visiting at peak times, finding a table should be no problem.  Staff members are dressed in German garb and the music is loud, overall creating a small feeling of being in Bavaria.    As expected, the beer is solid.  With whatever type of beer you choose, I suggest going for the 1L mug as it is an awesome feeling to hold that mug filled with so much drink.  My favorite is the hefeweizen, a wheat beer with a citrus taste that is great in summer.  The food is great too from appetizers to main courses.  The pretzels are hot and soft with a real cheese dipping sauce.  There are lots of choices for entrees but one can't go wrong with a wurst platter.  Jagerschnitzel (pork cutlet with mushrooms) is another favorite of mine.  Great place for food, drinks, or both!  Go with a friend or a large group on a warm summer night and you won't want to say "auf wiedersehen!"

GXiTXmoFi-cQaFSry1AA4w.text: My husband and I went here for a family party while we were in Pittsburgh over Thanksgiving.  We loved it!    We came in the afternoon because we thought it would be really difficult to get a table at night.   We were a party of 18.   First off  there is every beer imaginable.  You can get the 1 liter stein and purchase it or get a regular size mug.   They also have a full bar.   My husband got the large stein.purchased it.  We both got the 3 brats with saurkrat and potatoes but I substituted a potato pancake for the mashed potatoes.  They bring a basket of large pretzels with bier cheese to start.  The food is good, but it's the atmosphere that makes it fun.   We got there too early for the band, but they had an accordian player there who kept things lively by taking requests for toasts and offfering toasts.  It was a fun afternoon,

RoZ7eTQjgYZcLuAZIiwBIQ.text: My first review of 2018, a review I've been putting off because I wanted to give the Hofbrauhaus a second chance. But I can't go back. Was it the food, no, I enjoyed the huge pretzel and variety of flavorful mustards to dip the perfectly crunchy on the outside, chewy on the inside offering was. The beer was fine if that was you next thought. I had a sampling of all their beers which were all different in their own rights.   I'm not a huge fan of the South Side Works, but that wasn't the reason either. It was in fact that this place was over run with college students and it's noisy. I don't dislike college students mind you, it's just that they tend to take over. As I age, the bars I want to frequent need to be quiet, peaceful and if there are Televisions they need to be set to sports or CNBC. Lol.   It's not the fault of this establishment that I don't like the place, it was just built too close to two major campuses in the Burgh.

Nol00pBN72XW0aoEp114tw.text: I tend to prefer the more "authentic" places in the grittier part of Southside, but for what this is - an ersatz German beer hall - it's very well done, from the decor (which is on the fancier/nicer side of beer halls I've been in), to the beer (which is basic but good, again sticking to the German beer hall motif), to the food (again, think beer hall classics), and to the staff/atmosphere.   Speaking of the staff, they were friendly and helpful without being intrusive (thanks Kate!), although you might find the traditional costumes a bit much, especially in an era of heightened sensibilities. As for the atmosphere, I found the band very helpful to the overall vibe, but as others have pointed out, if you're looking for a quiet dinner/beverage, this probably isn't the best place for you - you'll definitely get much more out of this place if you're willing to buy-in and join in.

2QsbSRy_iNH1eXuHeAAA4Q.text: After walking 2 miles on the Three Rivers Heritage trail, my bf suggested to have a beer and dinner at Hofbrauhaus.. I almost tried to talk him out of it because who wants to eat carbs and beer after going on a 2 mile hike??   The reason for this update is to let you know Hofbrauhaus has amazing salads! I was stuck between the Munich Market Salad and Cobb Salad. I decided on the Munich. It had chopped romaine lettuce, strawberries, mandarin oranges, pineapple chucks, dried cranberries, glazed pecans onion and feta cheese. I added grilled chicken for an up-charge (you can also add salmon). The dressing on the salad was raspberry poppy seed.   That salad was ^&%$#@*  amazing! So fresh, so filling and tasty. It went perfect with the light beer option (Hefe Weizen.. my fav!!)   They also offered a Pittsburgh Salad as well as a few other options.  ****You can buy 6 packs to-go. Their beer is also sold at D's 6 packs & dogs

Bs6UxRwcxsF3OG9MApbnwQ.text: We came to the Hofbrau House as soon as it opened on a Friday for a special promotion luncheon for work. We ended up parking a couple blocks away in a parking garage which was fine, but I would have been happier if the valet was all day and not just for the dinner hours. We were greeted and met our party near the back of the restaurant. The seating is just like you would find at an authentic Oktoberfest in Germany, long community tables. I was so excited to try the food and hoped it would taste like the food did when we lived in Bavaria. Of course we started off with some Hefe Weizen, goes down like silk. Smooth and sweet just like I remember it. We also ordered the Pretzel and Bier cheese app and the Works Combo appetizers for the tables. Loved the sauerkraut balls and the potato pancakes with the apple sauce were fantastic! That works platter would also be good as an entree, a little bit of everything. I went with the original schnitzel for my entree. A huge piece of lightly breaded pork, still tender and juicy on the inside with cabbage, buttered spazetzle(substituted this for the potato salad) and a side of cranberries. I had never though of having cranberries with pork, but it was an amazing accompaniment. Loved it! It was also a very large serving with plenty of leftovers to take home. My husband had the Hot Brown. No bread in this as it had the potato pancakes for the base, tons of turkey, gravy tomato and bacon. This was the perfect sized lunch meal. During our meal there was also a man playing an accordion so we had some live German music. Definitely want to come back here again. Great food, great beer.

_taGCzoo4OROPFnWnpTN9g.text: I go out of my way for German restaurants/bierhalls and I can say for sure that Hofbrauhaus Pittsburgh is in my top 3 in the country.  I've been coming back to this place over the last decade and I can tell you that it's been solidly consistent in terms of quality too.  If you like German style beers, you can't go wrong with any of the options that they have on their menu.  From their traditional styles of year-round offerings (Munich Helles, Munich Dunkel, Hefeweizen) to the monthly rotating options, you'll never have a bad beer here. They have one or two rotating options that are on the hoppier side, but if you're the type of jagoff who refuses to drink anything other than IPAs/DIPAs/imperials, just go somewhere else.  Or consider the beers for their historical context and appreciate a different style that's well-executed.  There are few things more satisfying than the taste and heft of a 1 liter stein full of good quality German lager.    The food has always been fantastic here as well.  We always, as in 100% of the time, get the pretzels and bier cheese.  They are fantastic and are the perfect salty complement to your first liter of beer.  Everything that comes with The Works Sampler is also really good and it's good for sharing if you have 3 or 4 people. For my meal, I typically get the Wurstplatte and I've never been disappointed.  My only complaint about it is that I would rather that it come with a Weisswurst rather than the Frankfurter.  The Frankfurter is good, but I'd prefer the more traditional Bavarian white sausage. We've also had the Hot Brown and a couple of the schnitzels before as well and we've been satisfied with everything. I also recommend getting the Spatzle as a side.  I'd go with the buttered option, but the bier cheese Spatzle is also good, if a little on the heavy side.  I agree with some of the other reviews that talk about going on an off-night or earlier in the day if you are going on a weekend.  The wait can be pretty long Thursday nights-Saturday nights and it gets loud with the live bands.  If you're looking for a fun night out with friends, it's not a problem, but if you're looking for a quiet romantic dinner date, go earlier on the weekends or on a week night.

3HLRwUAyrb-24kmpKtUvDw.text: Great beer selections! Be careful, they give you a huge glass! If you are looking for authentic German food and culture, this is the place for you! oP5wavNzmoIVf0jQTjHHzg.text: We have eaten at the restaurant a few times and returned recently with a Groupon deal.  There were just two of us arriving around 4:30 in the afternoon but we were told 45 minutes due to a wedding party that had been dining.  It ended up only being about 10 to 15 minutes wait which was awesome.  Usually, we are asked if we would like to dine in the big room/hall but this time we were not asked.  They seated us in the other room (without the entertainment) and right next to the kitchen entrance.  I feel like maybe the door should be closed or something so that the customers are not looking at the serving staff entering and exiting the entire time.  We also would have preferred being in the other room but so be it.  The food was good but it is overpriced.  The portions for bigger meals are generous but we were not quite that hungry.  We ordered an appetizer (sauerkraut and ham fried morsels).  Very good!  My husband had the Hofbrauhaus Hot Brown dish and this was also very good. We ordered a side of the spaetzel which is simply phenomenal - it's one of my favorites!  I ordered one of the salads with fruit (Munich Market Salad).  I know that most people go to the restaurant to enjoy more traditional fare but if you offer salads, I would recommend using all fresh ingredients.  The pineapple on the salad was Canned Pineapple tidbits not fresh pineapple.  There were orange sections on the salad and when I bit into two of these, they had an 'off' taste, moldy type of taste.  Visually, they looked fine but I tried two pieces and experienced the same thing.  I bit into the third piece and had to spit it out because I tasted the same kind of taste.  If I was working in the kitchen, I would want to know this info.  I politely told the waitress that she may want to mention it to the kitchen staff that the oranges had a bit of a moldy taste to them.  I don't know if the cheese on the salad may have been a factor (moldy piece) and perhaps that is what gave the oranges that taste, not sure.....One of the managers then came out to address the comment. I appreciated the fact that they tried to quickly respond to a customer's concerns..  However, she proceeded to tell me that the chef had just opened the bag and had peeled that one and that it was very fresh.  She also said that he tasted one of the pieces that I had sent back and said that it was fine.  Now, if I recall anything about customer service, it does not involve coming out and insinuating that the customer was lying which is clearly what she did.  I had not asked for money off my bill, I had not asked for food, I simply had expressed that I thought the oranges tasted 'off'.  She then ended the conversation with an offer for a free side or something but at this point, I was kind of in disbelief and I just wanted to leave so I declined.  It really ruined what had been a fairly nice dining experience.  I would have given three or four stars but that simply is NOT okay to tell a customer - well we don't believe you and we think the food is okay???????  Despite the fact that we like the food overall, I doubt that we would return again.  Not cool!

n4TfsrQ5m1ANBm4LnTkuKw.text: This is a great place if you are an undergraduate student looking for huge mugs of beer, along with someone's idea of acceptable German food. lGiuDWLvzB08cFhP6-sLBA.text: I LOVE Hofbrauhaus!! The food is absolutely delicious. My favorite items to get there are the pretzels and beer cheese and their Chicken Marsala Spaezel. However, I have had their wurst and potatoes and that is wonderful too. They also have a great beer selection too! My favorite drink I've had there is their Oktoberfest. The best part of the Hofbrauhaus is their venue though. The inside of the building is the main restaurant/bar area which can get pretty rowdy at night. However, if you would rather have a quieter meal, you can go to the outside area which is picnic table style and overlooks the river. I went to the original Hofbrauhaus in Munich a few years ago and whenever I sit in the outside area, I imagine myself being back in Bavaria!

__BI-2KNyH2Ii1coW8dKog.text: Amazing food! I got to try German potato salad for the first time and it was very good! A little pricey maybe but the large portions make up for that and then some! We'll be visiting again for sure!

8M5Bz3IKyZXTkkLkQ7ejpA.text: This place is awesome. Hofbrauhaus is a must visit. I had a very good time, had some great beer, a nice traditional German meal and enjoyed the ambiance of 500 plus people having their time of their life.  My idea of a Beer Garden is good beer, good food, good signing and good fun. Hofbrauhaus was all this and more. As I walked in this place it was packed to the gills, but you were able to move around. Their was a wait for tables, Plan B the bar. After a few minutes, score bar seats. Let the fun begin; the beer:  Hofbrau Premium Lager was very good with 5.1% alcohol by volume. Lots of body. Nice finish.   Hofbrau Dunkel which was a dark beer with 5.5% alcohol by volume. Lots of flavor with a little spice kick. Also very nice. Lighter than most dark beers.  Hofbrau Hefe Weizen was fruity with a crisp finish. Very traditional and good. Alcohol at 5.1%  The beers were all good. They were easy to drink with lots of different characteristics. Very nice. At $5.50 a half liter, great price.  Ofenfrischer Leberkase - Thick-cut grilled pork and beef loaf topped with a fried egg and served with German potato salad. This was absolutely delicious. The pork and beef loaf was outstanding with great flavors. Never had warm German potato salad and it was a perfect compliment to the saltiness of the meat. Tangy, salty explosion of flavors. Yum. Entree was devour in less than 2 minutes; that is how good it was.  I realize that it was the weekend before Christmas, but this place was amazing with lots of fun had by a huge cross section of customers. It was as welcoming a place can be considering the huge size of the place. At different points in the evening the crowd would be signing along with the music. I know kichy, but FUN. Can't wait for a return visit and enjoy some delicious beer and food. Good job Hofbrauhaus.

NecVLAtqZwnGNOOXq0JfBQ.text: There are plenty of places to drink beer in Pittsburgh... more than plenty... maybe even too many... OK  so you want to swill some brew from the Fatherland do ya? My friend and I ordered soups... which never came.  My friend ordered the steak salad and I some spaetzle dish that was supposed to have "field mushrooms," Marsala wine, cream sauce, caramelized onions and chicken. I ordered a Hefeweisen to ease the pain and it was extremely herby tasting ... too much for my taste really... I asked for some lemon (yes you have to ask), and unsurprisingly, it too never came. z-EvyzaRgYGNEMaYPThrgQ.text: This is a theme restaurant/ale house in the styling of early 20th century German pubs. A local brewery and eatery, it Hoffbrau Haus offers a lengthy food menu, and many locally processed beers, and a few well-known national labels. Also included on the menu are monthly adjusted, seasonal beers imported from Germany. Pittsburgh is home to several locally brewed beer labels, "micro breweries" as they are often called. Hoffbrau Haus is uniquely designed to be both old-world cozy, and group-engaging. One can easily expect to be butted up against strangers with tankard in hand, singing German drinking songs, and yet having the time of one's life doing so.  Pros: local iconic establishment which is well run and maintains a single theme. The menu is diverse, with largely German fare. The comradery engendered in the early 20th century German pub theme is engaging. Cons: no easily accessible parking.

rduwJh7OqNp9aAFFddkzmg.text: Hofbrauhaus is one of my favorite restaurants in Pittsburgh because it's a dining experience. There's live music, great beer and surprisingly good food. My son loves to dance to the music in the front by the band, and it's so cute to watch. If you're coming on a weekend, come early before it gets super crazy and check in ahead of time on the no wait app.   You can't come here without getting the pretzels and bier cheese. The cheese is to die for! I love the hot brown, and basically anything on the menu with bier cheese, but the hot brown is a potato pancake with smoked turkey, ham and bacon on top, drizzled with bier cheese. What's not to love? And I'm not a beer drinker, but I love the hefe weizen. It's a light, sweet beer, and the only beer I'll drink.

A traditional German style beer hall with picnic-style seating and a few booths. Your best bet would be the upstairs balcony...NOT the downstairs gravel lot. I like when they have live ethnic music. 2c5vZD1oRIoPSYdkeR0UDg.text: This place is very popular especially among the younger crowd. But for me going here is like going to Disney world. Not because it's awesome but because when you go you remember why you haven't visited for 10 years. The main hall is EXTREMELY LOUD !  There is usually a live band playing polkas and people are seated at long rows of tables with people screaming to talk over each other and the music.   The food is okay. When we visited we arrived in time for happy hour (5-7pm) and saw on the website that to take advantage of happy hour pricing you had to go to the bar area. We asked the hostess if we could sit outside at a table and still participate and she said "anywhere" in the restaurant. But when we sat down at a table they said we were misinformed and would have to go to the bar if we wanted happy hour.   Outside there is a bar, and we had to belly up to get a limited selection of happy hour beers and pay a separate tab.   The appetizers were half price there.   The service was slow too. There was only one server (who was brand new) to cover too many tables.   Long story short, it will probably be another 10 years before I return and recall why I didn't go sooner. ts1JlUuZF_8toEW9v2EVlg.text: Hofbrauhaus is about the experience, not the food. -_Og2jPj4eCBY9vuv2tuJQ.text: I continue to be a devotee of Hofbrahaus despite not being a beer-drinker.   Who cares about mead when such items as the titanically flavorful vessel of breaded, fried pork called the Schnitzel Sandwich are on the bill of fare? The lettuce, tomato, red onion, pickles and bier cheese only compliment the flap of crisp, succulent pork held tightly within a Kaiser roll, making the foreign familiar and universal. The yinzer in me I had half a mind to ask for slaw and frites on top. Instead, the fabulous, dead-perfect Belgian-style tuber sticks came as a side.  I thought I tasted lard, which is always a good thing when devouring deep-fried foods.   The ultimate potato pancakes can also be had at Hofbrahaus. As thick as hamburger patties, they crackle like kettle chips on the outside, yet are plush, muggy, and starchy like au gratin spuds on the inside. So tasty were they, that I almost ignored the sour cream and applesauce that accompanied these precious, oily, crispy, shareable starters.   One must also consider the carnally creamy, benevolently bacon-laden comfort food tour-de-force that is the Hofbrauhaus Hot Brown...or Turkey Devonshire. No matter. You, the reader, the eater of good food, deserve such pleasures in an increasingly maddening world.   And dessert...praise Thor for dessert!  This time it would be the black monolith known as The Chocolate Stout Cake that would terrify my taste buds. Imbibed with yeasty, beastly, beery essences, the wedge of decadent darkness consisted of a frighteningly fudgy, dense body and an airy chocolate mousse frosting straight from Niflheim.  Is it touristy, ktschy, Epcot-ish? I am not concerned. The food makes its own statement, and that statement comes down bold like Mjolnir smiting mountains.   P.S. The service was terrific overall, and considering the restaurant had just opened for the day, we almost had it all to ourselves for most of our early lunch.  P.P.S. As Kay, her parents, and I gorged ourselves on the Teutonic delicacies, a gentleman in olden Germanic attire serenaded us with his accordion. Unfortunately, he knew no Blind Guardian songs.  P.S. The Hot Brown and the Chocolate Stout cake were specials and are not listed on the website's menu.

9M81Lm8cgJ0W_i1t4mITJA.text: Hofbrauhaus is like Oktoberfest at Disneyland, it's an experience and fun, but if you look too closely you can tell it's a corporate entity. Does that make sense? I guess I've been spoiled, in terms of German food by Max's Allegheny Tavern, and my own Grandmother, because I've found the food at Hofbrauhaus passable at best. If you want a truly German food experience you'll find Hofbrau watered down, and if you're not into German food, but like the idea of a German Beer House then get the baby back ribs.  Okay, maybe the above was harsh, but in general I enjoy the beer and sitting in the beer garden during the summer. It's great to look out on the river have a liter or two of their Premium Lager and get some pretzels and cheese sauce. All in all, when I'm at South Side works looking to kill a few hours with some day drinking Hofbrauhaus has my back. Also, it's a great place to bring your country mouse cousin when they're in town.

nXy9g5MinHVRXgndLJNeNg.text: All I can say is, LOVED This place when I lived in Pittsburgh. Can't wait to visit the St. Petersburg location. So happy there is one here in Florida.    I suggest any of the authentic German options, which are indicated on the menu. I get the roasted half chicken, then ask for different sides, I love the red cabbage and beer cheese spatzle. The German potato salad, the potato dumpling, and the fried cabbage are also amazing.   Planning on trying the potato pancake and pierogies when I can.

k8ft0zetzZLUEIclKOt7aA.text: Good beer and food. However, most of the time when I order a liter of beer it has lots of head (foam) and by the time it subsides I get a third of a liter of beer. Several of the guests reported the saur kraut, a Geman staple, was not good. Everything also seemed to have an abundance of salt, but that's common for restaurants. It is a good place for birthdays and is generally a fun atmosphere. Parking is not so easy.

3ngNGC5Vs8ddo8EdeOL1vw.text: I have wanted to come to the Hofbrauhaus since my 21st birthday but just made it here a few weeks ago.  To be honest, I don't get why people love it so much.  The food is very Americanized German, and the atmosphere is so strange.  I ordered the Bauren Schnitzel ($16.95), which was a Pork cutlet with Ham and American Cheese.  Think a cheap version of chicken cordon bleu.  It was the waxy American cheese.  This was the kind of thing I would expect to get from a dive bar or cheap diner.  I also had a dark beer that, while dark in color, was not dark in flavor.  It was fine just not what I expected.  My dad was super unimpressed with his Weisswurst.  So food was a bust, beer was ok.  I think the low point came when at 6:00 pm on a weeknight people were plastered.  The waitresses were serving multiple drinks to people simultaneously, which is illegal.  Some creepy old man who was there with his TEN children was double-fisting liters of beer.  And he and his children spent the evening running through the tables.  The Von Trapp family with a drinking problem?  Guess that's what I get for eating fake German food.  If you just want to drink, go to the Beer Garden at a time children are not allowed.  Otherwise, skip the Hofbrauhaus.

Zm8a3_OGZDeAOdHulswXGA.text: I've been here quite a few times in the past, but today was the first time I ever came for the lunch buffet (I had a coupon for $2 off).  The buffet was all you can eat, and included a nice salad bar, and a small selection of German foods, such as schnitzel, spatzle, three kinds of meats including brats, a wurst, (and I forget the name of the other one), cabbage, sauerkraut, German potato salad, mashed potatoes, two kinds of soups, and rolls with butter.  The only thing missing, in my opinion, were potato pancakes (kartoffelpuffer).   The beer was not included in the buffet, and today I had the August brew, "Sommer Weizen" (5.6 % Alc. by Volume, which is a darker, maltier version of the Weizen bier with hints of banana and clove).  I enjoyed the buffet, but would probably prefer to order an entree off of the menu next time.  Today was the first time I sat outside on the veranda, and it was pleasant sitting outside, watching the river and people go by on the nearby river trail.  Nice place for lunch, but no live music today, I guess that is only for when the bier hall is full of people.  Prost!

D2iKi5mXkGLUQDXRLT_pfA.text: If you've never been to Hofbrauhaus, you need to go at least once! It's a good place to start the night if you're planning to hit up South Side. They allow you do stand and dance on the benches to the accordion clad band.  The beer garden outside is nice during the summer if you want to talk with friends and escape the noisy band. The beer is brewed in house... not a big beer fan, but I do like to have one while I'm here.  The mixed drinks were blah. The crowd ranges from 21 to 60's.  Mostly people dressed preppy... read guys wearing pink polos.  For dinner, I was only impressed with 1 time out of 5 times trying it. The schnitzel was the best! German potato salad also was good. The pretzels with beir cheese are overpriced, but good if you're in the mood for that kinda thing. Overall, I'm sure I'll be back, but it's not at the top of my list.

WMFqNcnaZCfaY-OqoM1czQ.text: It's a fun night out at the HB in Pittsburgh's South Side. For a big beer hall I'm always amazed at how great the food is. It never disappoints! The schnitzel is best in the city, and the sausages are authentic German. The beer selection is great as expected. Best we like the atmosphere of the space - even on a slower night the place is welcoming and cheerful!

fhkkSH78Srs-Ik4CpNfPZg.text: Awesome beer, great food, amazing location. What's not to like? Just one thing to improve would be the service. Not saying it wasn't good, but the servers could be a little attentive. They seem to wander around without looking at anyone and that makes it harder to flag them down.

AeCA7hrQOKGQkasp_w0i4Q.text: I went to Hofbrauhaus Pittsburgh while visiting some friends on 6/6/15. I had an idea of what the experience would be like having been to the 1 in Munich Germany many years ago.   I am going to start with what I didn't like and then explain why I am giving it 4 stars. The restaurant is loud and I found myself screaming at my friends a couple of times so they could hear me. I am not sure if the spotty service was because our waitress was over taxed with tables or she gave us our space so we could continue drinking and eating. Either way, I would have liked her to check on us a couple of times more than she did. I would have liked 2nd drink but by the time she came around my friends wanted the check. The gift shop was also very limited with their sizes for tee shirts. I would have bought more souvenirs than I did if more was available.   However with all that being said it is a really fun atmosphere at Hofbrauhaus Pittsburgh. The band although they made the restaurant loud, I liked how they encouraged people to stand up on the stools and toast. I remember when I went to Germany part of the fun of beer gardens is making "friends" with strangers by toasting each other. The cover songs the band played also were very good; and, I thought overall the quality of the music was truly professional.   The portions of food like the beer are HUGE and really good. My pretzel and salad were both so delicious I forced myself to continue eating.   In a nutshell not a great place to go if you'd like to sit down and have a conversation with someone but a really fun atmosphere and a truly unique experience if you're in the area.

epJOQyoF_HPjqeYSf0IfpA.text: Love this place! It was my first time trying it out and the atmosphere was so unique! Loved the German music and attire -- gives it a real authentic feel. Plus, the food was DELISH! Definitely recommend.

mvhF7BcU68UqdeHHiubZnQ.text: If possible, I would want to divide this review into three separate portions: the food, the beer, and the atmosphere due to the fact each of these components would get a different rating from me. To sum up the food: 1.5 stars. I've tried several of their more traditional German items (Jagerschnitzel, sauerbraten, sauerkraut balls, and bratwursts) in addition to a few of their sandwiches (the Dunkel chicken sandwich and the pretzel sandwich) and have been very underwhelmed each time. It's always too salty, too greasy, and flavorless. I've tried some of the apps as well (sauerkraut balls and pretzels) and the pretzels, while they taste like those giant super pretzels you'll find in the freezer section of the grocer, are the only thing I will now order when here and only if I absolute need something to munch on with my beverage. The biercheese, again is overly salty, and was served practically ice cold on this last visit. We just used the regular old spicy Heinz mustard for dipping instead.   The beer, in addition to the atmosphere of the biergarten, is really the only reason why I personally come here. I would rate the beer at 3 stars. Out of their standard fare beers, I enjoy the Hefeweizen the most. I love the hint of  banana flavor and wheat beers are my second favorite (after IPAs of course!), and I highly recommend this option if you enjoy a wheat. It is perfect on a hot spring or summer day! They always have a "beer of the month" too, which happened to be a Maibock this month. I'm not really into the darker beers, and since that is mostly what is available here, I can't really comment on the darker ones myself, however my friends that enjoy darker beers rave about them, particularly the dunkel.   The atmosphere, particularly the outside Biergarten, is my favorite element of Hofbrauhaus. "I don't like to sit outside on a beautiful day and enjoy a cold beverage"-said no one ever! Or at least I hope no one ever......Anyways, it's beautiful near the river where you can watch the boats go by or people making use of the riverfront trail. You can also exit the biergarten right onto the riverwalk where the docks are located. Some of the tables have umbrellas which provided some much needed shade this past Sunday when it was 90 degrees outside! There are servers for the tables or you can enjoy watching a game at the bar, which is also a shaded refuge.   Just a note about my most recent visit this past Sunday afternoon. I went to use the restroom in the Biergarten and there was a female server literally having a melt down, screaming and swearing up a storm on her phone (to her mother since it was impossible to NOT hear her end of the "conversation" and I'm sure her mother really appreciated this on Mother's Day) about having to work out in the Biergarten and how she wasn't going to make any money because it was a Sunday, and she just "couldn't do this anymore". While it's not like this really bothered me,I just thought-obviously-it was extremely unprofessional to behave in that manner, particularly in the bathroom where paying customers could hear and see her. In this day of technology, I'm sure her whole cuss-word filled rant could have been communicated via text messaging. Just saying.   So in summary, come for the atmosphere, enjoy a beer or two, and I'd advise skipping the food in favor of one of the many other options in the South Side.

G2dNtW0M1ZvST4F3dzqxVw.text: I know this kind of a tourist trap/spot for the suburbanites because of its location and other things but I still like coming here. The food is always good and the beers. Well, the beers are out of this world.

_GL5tUchr6R9qZd-Eoz2Lg.text: This was a second visit to the Hofbrauhaus, and was one place we knew we would get seated without a long wait on a Friday night in Pittsburgh.  The atmosphere inside is a beer hall, with all the accompanying noise and liveliness, but we chose the terrace because it was a beautiful summer evening, and we would have a view of the river.  The food is hearty, ample and amazing.  For starters four of us split "The Works" sampler, which I highly recommend:  soft pretzels with beer cheese, potato pancakes with applesauce, fried pickles with ranch dressing, and sauerkraut balls with honey mustard.  Whoops, just had to wipe the drool off my keyboard.  Wursts, schnitzels, and meats oh my.  The fare is pretty authentic German with a few items thrown in for the hipster or pickier eaters in your group.  Not surprisingly there is a great beer selection.  A fun place to go.

8YdPFY4LaMVgI2sV7LnuDA.text: First off - I love their beer. It's always delicious, and it's definitely a fun atmosphere.  However, I think their food is a bit of a disappointment. I'm a vegetarian, and the things I've tried have all been mediocre at best.  Overall a fun atmosphere - but there are so many other cool places in the South Side, that I think this just doesn't live up to the hype.

9v9cRK32oXElzBe0l8nQMQ.text: I was traveling for work this week and staying at a nearby hotel.  I wanted something different than "national chain" restaurant food but close by and the hotel front desk recommended Hofbrauhaus.  It proved to be an excellent recommendation.  The service at the resturant was quick and efficient from the front door all the way through paying the bill.  The German food that we had was delicious.  I had the house brewed Hefe Weizen and Sauerbraten and Apple Streudel for dessert.  I'd highly recommend this establishment.

ooed9iRu0v0hkjy65GTKYA.text: My aunt and sister Vi and I recently went to this place and it was our first time. We were impressed by the ambiance (the giant dining hall, the waitresses' traditional German costumes). The huge dining hall was quite loud so that may be a bit offputting for some, but I enjoyed the lively atmosphere. It may seem odd for teetotalers to visit a German bier (beer) house, but we came for the food. And what delicious food it was! Wunderbar. I got a cheeseburger with fries and bier cheese and pretzels as an appetizer. I was shocked that they gave us 4 huge pretzels! When my mother and aunt went there last year they only received 2 pretzels. So good job guys. Vi said her potato pancakes with sour cream and applesauce were delicious (I can verify since she gave me a bite!) and my aunt enjoyed her generous Munich salad. Note that the more authentically German foods cost a bit more (around $18 to $22 per entree). Maybe next time I'll try the saurbrauten.

nTC6hNpBrWpvTVzlNbwFEQ.text: I haven't been to this hometown location, but I'll be back! What a beautiful night along the river. I've been to the Munich location and I actually like this one better! I had the schnitzel veiner art dinner, it was delicious! Our server was busy but he was very efficient and got us our food and drinks in a timely manner. I had a liter of the summer Weiss, it cold have been colder. It was a bit loud inside, I'm not sure if I would've liked eating dinner there but the band was really fun!

w4isaV0BwQ_vHcw0QWbQ1A.text: Been there three times in last 6 years. Great location, service was excellent each time, food was hearty German fare, no disappointments.  And the beer was cold and delicious. Prices a little on the high side, but the ambiance and scenic location make it a bargain. What's not to like? I dunno, it met all of our expectations. I give it 5 Stars!

cJGL203tQ7QmRapp_y60rQ.text: Great place to get some drinks and food, especially if you have a large group of people.  The atmosphere and setup inside is very unique.  Really sets the mood for their good beers and food.  For drinks, I have never had a beer that I did not enjoy here.  The Octoberfest and the Marzen are two of my favorites.  You get them in huge classes that you can keep as a souvenir if you want to pay for them.  Onto the food.  Hofbrauhaus has my favorite pretzels and beer cheese around.  The pretzels are cooked perfectly and the beer cheese has a smooth cheesy flavor which pairs perfectly.  For main dishes, I always go with their various bratwurst options.  Can't go wrong with any of them, especially if you get it topped qith their house made sauerkraut.

NkLjmq9jwwBOwtlIrwDncw.text: It was a beautiful day so we really enjoyed the view sitting on the outside terrace. It's located in a really nice shopping area. 8qIY6YuHpS_oWsFNgt_Uxw.text: I'm so glad it's finally summer so I can enjoy the patio here. I visited on a Wednesday for my monthly girls dinner. It was not crowded at all. nb8yfb24UiN5oqJzW3xLww.text: What a cool spot in Pitt! Enjoyed an evening here while moving in my sister to Pitt (H2P!) where I was able to catch up with a college friend who also lives in the city. She suggested this place because we both have a common love for beer (thanks to going to school in Wisconsin) and needed some good hearty food after a long, sweaty day in the dorms.   I loved the wide selection of beers-both foreign and domestic-that came in 1/2 and full liters. Very authentic. The inside of the restaurant felt like I was back in Berlin with the long bench-tables that could fit a solid crew. There is also ample outside seating which has beautiful views of the river.   The food was pretty good-nothing outstanding but the atmosphere made up for the average meal.The service was also extremely friendly and made you feel like part of the family. Highly recommend for a great beer scene and if you want to feel like you really are in Germany!

M6w7VfLyECAbueO2RsbRww.text: Hugh beer hall with a menu full of German style food. Beer is served in half liter or liter glasses that are as authentic as the motherland. Spaetzle, schnitzel, and dunkel beers...oh my.  staff is friendly and knowledgeable of the menu so don't hesitate to ask any questions.  Don't sleep on the German potato salad!

5YVOWmMk4YcF41bJoTpv0w.text: An exciting opportunity to experience the lively, rowdy crowd of German-inspired dining hall filled with beer glasses the size of your head, savory rich German delights, and live music to pair! Overall was a fun experience, but a re-evaluation of their spice blend in their sausages would be needed for me to try their Frankwursts, Bierwursts, and Bratwursts again.  Things I liked: - incredibly friendly, welcoming staff. This is always a huge plus to any dining experience! - Seating for all kinds of environments: relaxed, mellow outside and lively, full of excitement insight the hall. Have your pick! - We ordered a pretzel that came with 3 different kinds of dippings. Their in-house beer cheese, which was a savory rich cheese dip. My friend most enjoyed the honey mustard. It had a fresh bite of that mustard flavor, which was very refreshing. Lastly, we had a pinkish dip that was quite salty, savory, and rich. It reminded me of salmon spread, very interesting and delicious! The pretzel itself was enormous, well-salted and fluffy. Definitely a great appetizer. - Our three sausages came with a bed of sauerkraut, creamy mashed potatoes, and a drizzle of gravy over the protein. Both sauerkraut and potatoes were amazing!  Things I didn't like: - Perhaps a little more gravy. It was so good the lack thereof was a bit disappointing. - The sausages had overall great texture: biting into each of them was met with a satisfyingly crisp snap of the outer seal. However, I felt that they all were quite generic and could be improved with a more exciting blend of spices. What to put in? Who knows, but something that doesn't remind of me Canadian ham, breakfast sausage, or a hotdog.   Overall, a positive dining experience that was just short of something more memorable. I would be excited to try the other entrees off their enormous menu selections, but I'll have to hold on the -wursts.

cyYo6BgDWifTvaXYjVJsiQ.text: Except for going in a very busy night (1 hr wait) we had a great time/meal here.     These folks were super busy and low on staff the night we went. Justin was our waiter - he made recommendations of seasonal beers to try - we settled on the blueberry lager.  Was really good.  We also tried the sampler dinner which was delicious and enough food for two plus!

BPvQ9GElLmmR3csAunJX0Q.text: We had so much fun here.  We loved the roasted pork roast with the cracklings all around. It was tender and the cracklings were perfectly rendered. wyeTLY-GjXFxoEDtdeKNLg.text: Long wait but once you get in it is an experience, the food is great and the beer is as authentic as you can get out of the alps

TaQSDqx6dqzyhQ0EmU9lww.text: Hofbrauhaus is the sort of place I would insist upon taking a Pittsburgh visitor or newcomer to, as it so perfectly encapsulates all that is good and bad about Pittsburgh dining/diners. The joint: a chain, though one that's certainly hard to one by. The fare: gut busting German, slathered in sauces and heavy on the meats. The beer: delicious, and served by the liter. The patrons: loud, and numerous, especially on the weekends at dinnertime and beyond. I always enjoy coming here, though we don't come here that often. Compared to the rest of the chain joints in this part of the South Side, I'd definitely call this one first choice--even if it's just for the people watching and a heavyweight Dunkel.

dwE7KMQ_0caUqziOvRQJvw.text: In town for one night from DC and had a great time.  Food was decent but the beer, music and ambiance was part of what made this a great time for my wife and me.   The  best part of our visit though was the service - Kelsey was so helpful, so much fun and so doggone good at her job that even if the ambiance had "sucked" I'd make it a point to come back again. Thank you Kelsey- it was a tough night for us and you made it a lot of fun.  We are very grateful.

mTuppTTKKvckjamZhXjYLA.text: Been to the original and this was a decent replica. It's definitely a plus to the area of Pittsburgh. It's right next to the river, so get an outdoor seat if weather permits.  It's a huge building and the portions are also huge (so share or bring a crowd).   The pretzel and beer cheese were great. The wursts were quite yummy and juicy. The bread dumpling was slightly too dense and dry. The pork roast was also a smidge dry, but maybe these items are better on other days. The apple strudel was similar to the one in Munich, but I can't put my finger on it...it wasn't as good (maybe the layers were too soggy?)    Please don't come here to get a hamburger...there are a ton of great foods to try.  Prices were good and the overall experience was great. I wasn't here for the music or anything, but it looks to have a fun setup.

4ZVKhyqoYGRR0AxnLC83pQ.text: The atmosphere is certainly festive and everyone I went with said the beer was good (esp at that price). I am pregnant and can't drink so I can't comment. Ordered the Jaegerschnitzel- breaded cutlet "with a bacon, mushroom, and red wine sauce". The sauce was bland and there was no sign of the bacon, wine, or mushrooms. The cutlet was so overcooked the meat was gray. Ordered a side of mashed potatoes- bland and institutional tasting. I really enjoyed the German potato salad- not sure how authentic it is though! Definitely not the best German food in PGH and there are better (albeit chain) options if you're restricted to the SouthSide Works.

6r9W-kMZOYLyhdbF9iPA8Q.text: Slightly above average beer and slightly below average food. This place is more of an "experience" than just a place for food and drinks if you sit in the main hall. There will be people doing shots, a guy singing/playing the accordion, people getting up on the tables, etc. Next time I go back, I will consider sitting in one of the quieter areas or outside depending on my mood.

JP-jFlJSXrHWy6NYSWYBuQ.text: The few times I've been, I have not been impressed. The service has been slow, orders gotten wrong, and the food just isn't that great. I'm not a big beer drinker, but the people I know who are like the selection. It is fun to have polka-esque live music. I would be fine eating home-made German food and not going back to Hofbrauhaus.

i4wRkj-zGOkYrsiWUMtX5A.text: Although only 4 year round beers and 1 rotating tap, beer is solid and cheap (less than 6 bucks for a half liter, less than 10 for a liter).  The pretzels are delicious, and the potato soup is awesome.  I would only go when weather is good enough for outdoor seating because it is on the river and has a great view, also because inside is too rowdy with a lot of drunk assholes in the beer hall.  It gets so bad on weekends that police officers wait outside for any issues that arise in the beer hall.

01JCs8kxMNB7feVlkNeVCA.text: I wish there were a couple more of these places throughout the country. Amazing, genuine German food coupled with some of the best German beer there is.

iKvn7XSFj8_dZxcl5rNbng.text: I cannot emphasize enough how awesome this place is. Traditional German beer hall. The food is outstanding, I've never had a bad meal. The bier cheese needs to be tried.   Beer, let's be honest, this is why you come here. Two sizes, liter (as big as your head), half liter. All brewed on premise. 4 always on tap (my favorite is the Dunkel) and a monthly beer.   The staff is also a blast. From the rocking house band, to the polite wait staff, to the imposing security, everyone is nice as can be. Get up and jam. You can dance on the benches until your legs can't hold you up, but stay off the tables.   I recommend this as a stop anytime you visit Pittsburgh. When you are there, ask for Big Andy and tell him Neil said hi.

photos.caption: Photo of Hofbrauhaus Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The band rocking out.

TghbrirvWFrfQQClZ4cPtQ.text: Whew. Wow. So, lemme get right to it.  I went to college in Pittsburgh but moved away from the city in 2010. When this place opened, it was THE PLACE to go on a Friday or Saturday night. The music, the big tables, the big beers, the bier cheese pretzels....  Flash forward to last month when I was back in town for a college friend's wedding. My boyfriend and I came here on a Thursday night with two other friends. The weather was nice, and we opted to eat outside. The place was already pretty crowded, and it was only about 5:00 or 6:00pm. I'm not big on German food, and I ate here a couple times in college, but I had never gotten the ham and cheese sandwich on a pretzel bun, which is what I got this time. Wow! What a great sandwich!!!  My meal was really good. The boys ordered a little too much food for themselves and couldn't finish it all, but we all ate a really good dinner. My boyfriend, who had never been to Pgh, LOVED this place.  After dinner, we stayed for quite awhile, and as the night progressed, we felt so much more out of place! We definitely felt like the old people in the place, and we're only in our late 20s!  I guess in the recent past, Hofbrauhaus has gotten into trouble with how they serve their alcohol, so they've gotten REALLY strict about when they'll serve you another beer, and they DON'T do shot skis anymore. We were ID'd when we walked in, by our server, and each time at the bar, too. We didn't get angry about it, though, cause we definitely saw some people that we gave questioning looks--they looked like college freshmen...  Anyway, we had a great time, but we were all much more sober than we EVER were when we came here in college, so that's why I only gave it three stars this time. I guess it'll just never live up to the memories I have here in 2008-2010 :-)

caIZ8UcT64abZpwaINH1gA.text: This place is bananas. Giant beers? Check. Awesome food? Check. Good location? Check. Second visit, first review. The food is amazing. bxFCPDt2xWaqboZbPPwHOQ.text: Happiness = (Meat + Beer + Carbs)^2  Was looking forward to this place prior to moving to Pgh this past summer.  The first time I visited this beer garden was when I visited the original one while on a beer garden crawl in Munich.  Beer was great.  Meat was great.  Truly memorable experience in Germany.  Now that I've been in Pgh since summer of 2013, this Pgh branch has not disappointed me at all.     Food (8.0/10) = Seems like not many people like the food here.  I personally love what I've ordered.  1. Bavarian Jagerschnitzel = flattened pork smothered in mushroom, bacon, and gravy.  2. Oktoberfest Schweinshaxe = big fat ass pork shank with crispy crackly skin.  ?Beer? = duh.  Hofbrau Hefe Weizen and the Hofbrau Dunkel.  1 L.  No BS with these beers.  Ambiance (9.5/10) = The beer garden is very close to the river.  I havent been in Pgh long, but I don't know any other place with outdoor seating along the river.  The garden is the best.  Has a "community" feel to it.  Haven't spent much time inside yet since weather has been good, but looks like a party is going on every time I walk thru.  Service (8.0/10) = Good service.  I get my beer and food.  That's important.  Overall Opinion = Haven't been disappointed by this joint at all.  The best asset of this place, other than the beer, is the beer garden.  If looking for outdoor dining/drinking in a very casual chill environment, check out Hofbrauhaus Beer Garden level.

We ordered, and my 30 year old brother, his 29 year old wife and I (25 years) were asked for identification. My parents were with us and were not carded. We told them we were biking so we didn't have our wallets, and told them our ages, and our dad confirmed we are adults. The waiter wasn't having it. My dad said, "okay cool we'll just get liters then" and the waiter took the order without comment. My parents shared their liters with us, and the manager came out and said "though I can see that you are old as you say, I'm afraid we cannot serve you alcohol and have to ask that you not drink any." uZLyhmAdE_04rNfuOAVsqQ.text: Hofbrauhaus is definitely a novelty restaurant and not somewhere I would frequent.   The environment is interesting where they take on the full atmosphere of an old German beer hall. I don't even know what those would be like but I imagine that it's most similarly like this. The women were clad in scantily short skirts and dresses that really highlighted their boobs. I don't think anyone could have been safe from those...  Anyway, the food. My friends got the Dunkel Bourbon Chicken and Schnitzel sandwich while I got the garden burger. First of all, it was hard enough trying to find something on the menu when everything was unpronounceable. The food itself was okay, the garden burger wasn't my taste because it seemed like they tried to put a mexican-style spin on it while still trying to keep the german flair. My friends seemed to enjoy the Schnitzel and Bourbon Chicken but the mashed potatoes were nothing special and she left the entire thing on her plate.   Overall, I would definitely take someone here purely for their aesthetics but probably wouldn't come here anytime otherwise.

qtCkwpo3R7SWI2oB0vkJpQ.text: Hofbrauhaus is a whole lot of fun.  Servers in costume, a beer hall, and gigantic beers.  If you are in the mood for a non-quiet meal, you should definitely sit in the beer hall.  They have live entertainment (on most days I think) in a wide open seating area.  If you want something a little more peaceful, the patio is nice and has a decent view over the river.  Pretty much everything on the menu is either meaty or deep fried so this is not the place for trying to eat something light, but as long as you are not, everything is delicious.  If you have people to share with and plenty of appetite, the sampler plates are a good way to try a variety of foods - they have them for appetizers, wursts, and entrees.  The beer is great too, and comes in 1 liter steins (they also have 1/2 liters, if you don't want that much).  With tasty German food, beer, and a unique atmosphere, Hofbrauhaus is definitely worth a visit.
