6gRVkOZUI0LNp6BsVNcp9Q.text: When the Schatzi said he was taking me to Hofbrauhaus for lunch last Sunday, I died a little inside. I immediately recalled the inedible meal that I had been served at Munich's Hofbrauhaus. Boy am I glad I kept an open mind, because I had a delightful time at this place!  First, our server, Karen, was the bee's knees! She was pleasant, attentive, and friendly. The food didn't hurt my feelings either. My boyfriend ordered the massive pretzel appetizer and he loved it. He's about the proudest Bavarian from backwoods Bavaria you ever did meet, so he knows him some pretzels if'n ya know what I mean! I ordered the cheese fries. I'm not a big fan of cheese sauce on my fries; I prefer the real deal! But these things were A-mazing. I could eat that cheese sauce by the spoonful. Also, when I asked for my Southern tzatziki aka ranch dressing, Karen didn't culture shame me. So gracious!! And speaking of the ranch, unexpectedly good -- at a Bavarian restaurant, no less!! Maybe even house made?  Now let's talk about that schnitzel. I had the Jagerschnitzel and it was awesome. It tasted pretty authentic, but what does authentic mean? I'd be lying through my teeth if I said I never had crappy schnitzel the whole time I lived in Germany, and I'm pretty sure all of those schnitzels -- even the less tasty ones -- were made by Germans. The schnitzel was not heavily breaded, which I prefer. The hungry Bavarian sitting to my left said that, although his schnitzel didn't taste authentic to him, he didn't care because it tasted so good.  It's a regional thing; an Oma in one town probably has a completely different prep style than an Oma in a town a couple clicks away.  To all ye hipsters, stop beating ye auld drumme of authenticity!  Since we're on the subject of hipsters, there was a noticeable lack of hipsters and young intelligentsia cluttering up the booths. Can I get an amen, praise Jesus, and a hallelujah all at once?!? It could be because Hofbrauhaus is a -- gasp! chain restaurant! Fine by me. The pleasure of a dining experience is inversely related to hipsters. Score!  Another score? The serving sizes should come with a warning. A skull and crossbones would be too severe, but perhaps a "consult a physician before..." could be helpful. Seriously, though, anything that saves this girl money and doesn't skimp on quality? Win-win in my book!  Would I go back?? No need to threaten me with a good time!

hiC14Cx2lBXBNn-EQBAwPQ.text: I probably would have rated this higher before I ate hofbrahaus in Germany. The food doesn't compare but is still good. Love the beer garden. Be prepared to fight for a table in the beer hall. And if you like a nice quiet atmosphere, this isn't the place for you! Something fun you should experience in Pittsburgh.

EYsWDC-WGVXrV64V4xe3Jg.text: I love this place! The location is good but its impossible to find parking. The food is great but they don't offer mustard without a 2$ upcharge which is just ridiculous. The beer is great but the staff should be trained better on what they're telling the customers. Still, great place to grab some Bavarian food.

MnP3O8i7JcGu2OdaSxcD5Q.text: This restaurant was amazing! My family and I went here for my 21st birthday a couple of days ago and had a blast. Everyone had a good time hanging out in the spacious restaurant. Everyone enjoyed their drinks, and the food was great. I had some kind of schnitzel and loved it. Also, we ordered many appetizers: the pierogis, spinach artichoke dip, and the pretzel. All delicious!   The service was great, our waitress was tentative and made sure everything was in place. Then when it got busier more staff came out to help. The whole time there was live music playing from an accordion! This guy sung in German and enhanced the atmosphere. The only thing I would change about this place is the lack of parking. There was no parking for at least a block around the restaurant. Otherwise, we had a great time and I'd highly recommend it!

QmJ-O5z4miJN_qD2rRnxTQ.text: First time hanging out for summer in the Biergarten, and I can say if you want to have a fun time with friends slangin some delicious drinks and enjoying a great view, then this is the place to be! They let you add flavors to the lagers like blueberry and key lime and the blueberry was delicious! It was a really nice first evening or Summer to be outside and enjoy the amazing ambiance. It's nice you can seat yourself but arrive earlier because it gets packed. We were sitting a while before a server came over. She was super friendly and nice the whole evening but we didn't receive our meal until about an hour later since she had so many tables to herself. It was clear they were super understaffed. Food was average but nothing super impressive. We would pass on the food next time and just stick to drinks. I did however love the sauerkraut and I don't even enjoy sauerkraut! haha delish.

e2FN6A1Q-ibOAi_VX4RbkA.text: This place is AWESOME!  Giant beers and large portioned entrees are the name of the game.  I had a Bavarian Jagerschnitzel which was absolutely outstanding.  It was a great entree to get here because it would take forever to make something similar at home, if I even could.  Plenty of flavor everywhere.  My son had a Wurst on a Bun which was just kind of so-so.  The Bratwurst was good, but it was just a pretty plain meal for a place that offers so much more.  Fries, roll, brat, sauerkraut on the side...thats it.  Check the picture out if you want to see what I mean.  My wife had a Dunkel Bourbon Chicken Sandwich and it was pretty awesome too; she was very happy with it.  This was upon recommendation of our server who was very good.  My youngest had something off the kid menu for $5.99; he didn't ruin my lunch with a temper tantrum, so I give his meal an A+ even though I don't even remember it.  The only knock on them, which is completely avoidable, is their flavored beer.  They just pump some fake flavoring into their regular beer which results in a degradation of a perfectly decent brew.  They offer 3 free samples per person, so if you are thinking you are going to go that route, sample that bad boy first, you might be pretty happy you did before you have a liter of it in front of you.   Ultimately, great restaurant, really great actually.  I can't wait to come back here again, I want to try something different but its going to be awful hard to pull the trigger on something other than their schnitzel.

-m6dZnxgmWWGxw-lHZiwhg.text: Food is good, but expensive.  Sit outside in the summer time! On busy evenings, you can find people drunk and singing on the tables inside. It's great.   Schnitzel is always the answer as to what to order.

bFPhxUCSr5JXZfDFdrIJ1Q.text: After living in Munich for a summer, I am blessed to have this location of Hofbrauhaus so close. Great beer, great food and great entertainment. I just went on a Friday night for some post dinner beers, dessert and entertainment and it was perfect for that. Yes, this is also a great place to celebrate a birthday, or take a big group but it's also great if you want to just listen to the music, have some beers and people watch.   You can not go wrong with any of their beers and their apple strudel was very good. Make sure to check out their seasonal beer when you are there. I highly recommend it.   TIP: You can put your name on the waitlist through yelp and see your place in line. We had 12 tables ahead of us and it was not much more than a 20 min wait.

zFV8XzqlwXnFlr44tmqtrw.text: The Hofbrauhaus in Pittsburgh is an experience.  I have been to the Hofbrauhaus in other states and knock offs as well as the original and this held its ground.  Definitely the best in the states.  My wife and I got there around 8pm on a Saturday and there was a 2.5 hour wait!  We were able to get seats at the bar which worked fine.  It's great they brew their own beer.  The lager was on par with Germany.  I found the funnel a little maltier.  For dinner I ordered the Muncher Weisswurste.  This is a traditional Bavarian lunch which has two sausages served poached that you peel the skin off with a soft pretzel.  The skin peeled off easily which normally doesn't happen stateside.  They did a great job.  Nearly the whole crowd in the beer hall was getting into the music and dancing on their chairs having a great time.

KIhvQzC7WrnzgGpYEv2veg.text: Yesterday my partner and I decided to come here for dinner and a beer. Mostly for the beer. Our waitress, Abby, was great. To me, she is the gold standard that all other waiters & waitresses will be measured against from here on out lol.   The beers were great and we had a fantastic time but I have to comment on the wurst meals we got. Generally they should come with some type of hard crusted roll and German mustard. These came with hotdog buns, and not just any hotdog bun but the cheapest white bread bun kind available. And the mustard available at the table is picnic grade Heinz yellow mustard. Great for grilled burgers and hotdogs but not for bierwurst or bratwurst at a German restaurant.  We had a bit of a chuckle about it, beer probably helped with that, but next time I am going to ask for ways to customize that order.

mynKRkWjw4t2GdQqOpcBjg.text: OK. So I'm half German and never ate at a German restaurant before so I thought it might be cool that the family wanted to go. So I looked on their website and was iffy The rows of tables as if you were in a high school cafeteria didn't excite me. The menu had LOTS of pork items on it. I'm OK with that but it didn't seem as if they really had enough of other things on it.  We arrive and as we walk past the reception area I could not believe at how LOUD it was in there. I even said, "It is FAR too noisy in here." and I could barely even hear myself say it.  While the girls working there wore cute little German style dresses I noticed the guys just wore shirts and slacks. That's no fun at all. The only guys I saw in German style clothes was members of the band who only set up and tested some stuff before we left. But with as LOUD as the place is I'd think having live music would be utterly worthless.  There was SOOO much noise from EVERYBODY else talking that I couldn't hear anybody at my table. A cousin's kid was across the table and 2 away from me and I could hear him talking but not anything he was actually saying. My cousin at the  other end of the table cold not be heard at all. If I didn't see her mouth moving I would not have believed she was talking at all.  The bathrooms are completely wrong. No paper towels, just air blowers. Yes, that right, I might as well just have had all of the other customers fart on my hands until they were dry. I HATE THAT! Then to make it worse, you have to PULL the doors to leave. So now if other customers didn't wash their hands then it makes it completely worthless if you did. Apparently customer hygiene isn't a concern of theirs.   It is absolutely ridiculous at how much you can hear EVERYBODY ELSE in the place EXCEPT the people you are with . Since I couldn't hear anybody I just spent most of my time just watching one of the TVs. What a complete waste of spending time with family from out of town.   I got the white sausage, veal and pork. It was good but found it silly that it's side was a pretzel. Especially since they are appetizers and desert too. I also got a potato dumpling which I liked. I'm glad I did cause the 2 sausages and pretzel would not have been enough. But overall it was OK. I mean how can you screw up pretzels. A cousin go pierogies which were fried which I don't prefer to be done that way. Both of my sisters and my mom got the french dip. They liked them, especially the pretzel roll but felt the meat was a bit dry. I was thinking about that at first but was disappointed that it only came with fries which could be swapped out for soup or salad but not any other side.  It finally started to be a LITTLE less noisy as some people left but then they turned on music which made up for the loss of people. So STILL you can't hear a single person you are with. So completely stupid.  Let's not forget that this is South Side too where parking already sucks big time. But they are the very back and are not too close to any parking so you are pretty much forced to use their valet parking.  Since the sound of EVERYBODY else being so stinking loud it forces everybody else to talk louder just so they can hear each other. This just compounds the problem. The noise level is so utterly over the top, ridiculously absurd that I just cannot state it enough.  If they could fix the noise problem somehow it would raise it another star. Fix the bathroom issue AND make EVERYBODY were German style clothes would raise it another star. But this would never be a 5 star place. Just FAR TOO MUCH LOUD NOISE for that to ever be possible. I will NEVER go back here, unless I am completely deaf.

MJNkf9DiPO9zOH2OKr1XOw.text: We had a great experience at Hofbrauhaus tonight.   I had the pork shank, & it was terrific. Not only was it fall-off-the-bone tender, but it also was highly flavorful.   The table shared an order of pretzels with cheese sauce, & they were very good too.   Our waitress was efficient as well as personable.   The ambience here is a major plus. EuBzZEPzDRiHWp_Zu_exVw.text: This was my first opportunity to try Hofbrauhaus and believe me it did not disappoint! When I arrived for lunch the place was fairly empty and I could sit anywhere I wanted. The restaurant resembles a big German beer garden with waiters and waitresses dressed in authentic attire. There is a large bar for German beers and you really feel like you are in Germany here.  I had a very friendly and helpful waiter who told me that at lunch they have a smorgasbord style meal for $11.99 where you can eat at their salad bar and then have as much as you want of authentic German food. Pretty good deal but I felt that would be a little too much for me. I inquired about gluten free, vegetarian, and children's items. My waiter gave me a separate menu for each of them. Sorry, there are no vegan options here.  Normally their sandwiches come with fries but you can "swap" them out for free as long as they are listed on the regular sides menu. Certain ones carry a small up charge. I want to try their schnitzel sandwich and asked if I could have it on a pretzel roll. He told me I could for $.99 more. No problem here. I swapped out the fries for a broccoli and bier cheese combo.  I had my food in no time and believe me the size on that schnitzel was almost like the size of a large fried fish you would find in other restaurants. Needless to say it was very good and quite filling! The broccoli and cheese were cooked to perfection! One of the hostesses came to me and chatted with me about my food and explained the restaurant concept. I really felt welcomed here. I was offered dessert but that sandwich was all I could handle. Maybe next time.  Hofbrauhaus is located on Water St next to a hotel on the back side of Southside works. Metered street parking is available on some of the side streets. It sits near the Hot Metal bridge where there is a parking garage if you find you are having trouble parking.   Please note Hofbrauhaus is a chain restaurant and you will find it in other cities. This place is very popular and does get crowded at night. Definitely worth a visit!

vsRFFpWo78caf4pr6VDWZA.text: Came here for the first time for dinner on a Friday night.  Ordered their Works sampler appetizer, the Bavarian sampler plate as an entree.  We also ordered a half size beer and a full size beer.  What's Hot  - Cost.  We came here because of a Groupon.  The groupon is $13 for at least $25 worth of food, which is a pretty decent deal.  With the groupon, however, our total was around $50.  Still paid a lot for the evening, but that they have savings is helpful. - Menu variety.  There are appetizers, sausages, roasted pork, sandwiches, desserts, plenty of drinks, etc...  If you're not into beer, there are mixed drinks, cocktails, shots, etc...  They have monthly food specials.  The variety is helpful. - Portions.  You definitely get what you pay for.  Our appetizer had everything and it was a lot of food.  Our sampler plate main entree was definitely a mountain of food.  I recommend sharing food, which may help cut down on cost, as well. - Quality.  The food was pretty good, but not knock your socks off.  The fried sauerkraut, in the sampler appetizer platter is pretty good.  Hubby is not a fan of sauerkraut and he really enjoyed the fried sauerkraut.  It doesn't have the usual tang and had an added type of potato flavor.  Really good fried pickles too- not too sour and not overly battered.  The pretzels were warm and soft.  The potato pancakes were just fried or heated.  Highly recommend their bier cheese dip. - Service.  Pretty good and definitely not rushed, which is nice because this is a place where you will be taking your time.  It wasn't completely full when we came, so I'm not certain what their service is like when they're packed and busy.     - Location.  It's right on the river, so the view is great no matter when you go.  There's also a lot of other places around the restaurant- other shops, restaurants, grocery stores, etc...    What's Not - Cost.  The food is pretty pricey.  The sampler appetizer is $14 and the Bavarian sampler entree is $34.  There are less expensive items on the menu.  However, this is a beer house.  Even with the groupon, our total was around $50.  With drinks and food, It's easy for your tab to add up, so be aware.   - Parking.  There's no free parking in the area.  You can either go valet or pay for parking on the street.  Be prepared, especially depending on which day and time of day you go.   - Service.  The main thing we didn't like about their service is that you can only get help from your assigned waiter.  For example, other wait staff would bring us our orders.  But if we asked for anything, like additional water, bier cheese, or whatever, they said they had to get or waiter in order for us to tell that specific person.  That slows down service.  Final Answer Would come back, but wouldn't be a first choice.  Would only return because bringing someone to show them or with others who insisted on coming here

sNazrhJqjGv_2CnU97p6Kg.text: This place confuses my sense of what is right and wrong.  The food is gross, the beer is gross...and yet the beer is so cheap, and there's soooo much of it.  This place has become notorious for getting people drunk enough that they end up murdering somebody with their car.  But I'm not really sure who is really to blame. The music is fun.  The service is pretty great, and to be honest, the few times I've been here when it's really crowded, there hasn't been any overly rowdy behavior, so the security presence was probably a good idea.  The food, as I said is really very gross.  And there is a thing called the Hot Brown, which makes me immediately think about what's going to be happening to my body at some point in the future.  Don't call something the 'Hot Brown' unless you're a Doctor trying to explain diarrhea to a child as gently as possible.  Other things are not so bad, and I'll admit that at a certain level of intoxication, I will shamelessly eat a plate of sausages like I'm in an eating contest with the devil. AbMajDFv25o0WMS5RQxncA.text: I have lived in Pittsburgh for nine years and have always loved coming to the Hofbrauhaus, so now that my boyfriend and I are moving away, we decided to host my birthday party/ our going away party outside in the beer garden by the river. For the most part, we had a lovely time, enjoyed a nice atmosphere with good food and drink and decent service and it was the right venue for hosting all the friends we've made over the last 9 years.  But I feel compelled to add that the end of the evening was unpleasant. I should preface this by saying that my boyfriend and I and most of the friends who were there with us met or currently work in food service and are respectful and understanding of business hours and closing procedures at other establishments. We knew ahead of time that the place closed at 1am, and we had every intention of being ready to go at 1am. But starting at midnight, the wait staff started taking drinks away left and right, rabidly clearing our tables if we dared to look away or visit an adjacent table. Then at 12:30, I was told I had missed last call and I couldn't get another drink. Fine -- I didn't need one anyway, but keep in mind my last one had been taken by an overzealous busser while I was hugging someone goodbye.  At 12:45, we were reminded that we had 10 minutes left to finish our drinks. "Great, thanks!" we said, planning to comply. At 12:50, a wall of security guards more or less stood around us, and they brought a police officer over to cross his arms and pretty much just scowl and stare intimidatingly at us as we tried to say our last goodbyes to good friends, which, to say the very least, put a damper on the festivities. I got the sense they were looking for any excuse to kick us out.  If you advertise your hours as being 11:00 am - 1:00 am on a Thursday night, then I think it's only fair to allow your customers to enjoy themselves until the announced closing time. Don't strong arm your customers into leaving before then. We weren't being drunk jerks, we weren't trying to order a lot of food or shots or anything, we were just trying to finish our drinks and say our goodbyes, but the waitstaff and security team just surrounded us with death stares for the last 20 minutes of the night. Had it been 1:15, I'd have completely understood and would have rounded up any oblivious revelers as quickly as possible as part of a cooperative and sympathetic effort, but that was not the case.  If not for that, I'd have given them a 5-star rating, but "last" impressions matter, too.

nkLXYKRIoWq5SMaLf6Q-HQ.text: We came here the other weekend with a fairly large group of friends (including a few of their small kids). I have been to the Hofbrauhaus in Cincinnati and done the crazy dude bro drink-and-stand-on-the-tables-all-night experience....for this outing, however, my friends and I came here on a tame Sunday evening for dinner.  Despite it being a Sunday, the atmosphere was still fairly festive, with a loud accordion player gleefully playing German tunes through the hall. Luckily, our big group was seated a bit off to the side out of the main dining room by the bar, so we were still able to hear ourselves talk and think. This was my first time being in the Pittsburgh location, and it looks like it would be really beautiful in the summer -- they have a gorgeous outdoor space that overlooks the river. Unfortunately it was February, so all I could do was look longingly at the patio and wish for warmer days.  So as I mentioned, I came with a fairly large group of friends, which included 3 toddlers. I'm not sure if this made our table undesirable or whatever, but the service was pretty abysmal. Our waitress took forever to take our orders, rarely came over to refill our drinks, and just in general pretty much ignored us the entire time. I don't know if she was just a terrible waitress or if she thought maybe the effort-reward ratio was not favorable enough to put up with such a large group. But either way, it was highly annoying to everyone and soured our experience.  As for the food, it was pretty pricey and was on par with the quality you'd find at, say, an Applebee's. Very run of the mill. I got the Dunkel Bourbon chicken sandwich with a potato pancake in place of the fries. The sandwich was unremarkable -- the chicken breast was oddly shaped (way too thick and too short), so it didn't fill the bun at all. The bourbon sauce didn't have much dimension to it -- it was mostly sweet, with only the slightest hint of tang from the bourbon. Although the sandwich was a bust, I did enjoy the potato pancake -- it was crispy without being greasy and had a delicious onion-flavored potato filling. My friends also felt pretty ambivalent about their meals -- the reuben, the schnitzel sandwich -- every item my group ordered was met with a "mehh." Not terrible but not great (especially for the price).  So my takeaway from this experience is that this is not a place to target if all you're in the market for is a good dinner. Perhaps their wheelhouse is beer and merriment, but food and service definitely ain't it.

a_YByWO5P3CXKEURlIvucA.text: I like the set up and the high ceilings--really adds to the old German beer hall atmosphere. Hofbrauhaus really strives to set itself apart from the other restaurants in Pittsburgh and it definitely earns its gold star for being quite unique. I also really like the outside seating and the view of the river. Great location! I don't like beer in general so I didn't order their beer.   When it comes to the food and service, however, I thought it's a bit on the lacking side. Our waitress was rude and impatient. I'm not familiar with German food or language, so of course sifting through the menu took longer than wanted. The waitress got a bit snappy when I asked her to explain some items on the menu. I ended up ordering the Ofenfrischer Leberkase, which came with a slice of meatloaf, a fried egg on top and some German potatoes. The meatloaf straight up tasted like processed meat with the rubbery consistency of cheap hotdogs. The potatoes were okay and fried egg tasted like fried egg. I did not enjoy my meal.   Overall, I respect the effort and creative attempt to imitate a German beer hall. The rating I'm giving is a very reluctant 3 for the concept. When it comes to the actual food, I don't think this place lives up to all the hype. I recommend Hofbrauhaus as a place to try for the experience, but definitely not a place I will return to satisfy my taste buds.

USlef7IUPb-t1NWA0Haxyw.text: I stopped by here this past Saturday with my wife.  While we have both been to Hofbrauhaus before I don't know that we had ever been there together and so it must have been at least 8 or so years since either of our previous visits.  The reason that we ended up coming here is that we saw that they were having an Ocktoberfest.  Whenever we arrived at around 2 PM the line to be seated was literally out the door and for whatever reason it took about 10 minutes to get seated.  This was weird because there were quite a few empty tables in the dining room and they definitely had servers going to them later.  In any case we were seated in a booth in the beer hall.  Besides the booths there were also giant communal tables and a bar in there.  It was massive with the ceiling a couple of stories tall.  Then since it was Oktoberfest they had an accordion player and for awhile there were dancers as well.  On this day my wife and I were just looking for some appetizers and drinks and so we decided to split the pretzels with beer cheese and then each ordered a half a pint of beer.  I chose the dunkel while my wife went hefeweizen.  Our beers came out first and they were what you would expect of German beers.  While I generally like more exciting beers, these were both good interpretations of their styles and my wife and I both easily drank them.  The pretzels and beer cheese here were also good.  Our beer cheese had a great flavor without too much beer while the pretzels had a nice and crusty exterior and then a soft interior.  The bottom line for me is that I would head back here again in the future.  Both our appetizers and beer were good and I would be interested in trying some of their entrees.

MZ2fxWWBY2GZJA_41NO-GQ.text: I like Hofbrauhaus, and I hope they never give me a reason to dislike them so much that I would never return, but this past experience was a little frustrating. We went for Oktoberfest and we were prepared to deal with the extra crowds that the event would draw. The crowds and frenzy were there, but for what? One special beer and one "special" dish which I would argue that it was actually pretty ordinary being that it was just roast chicken. No other specials, no bands, no price discounts, not really special in any way. The food was good as it always is, but we were expecting something more than just a regular meal at Hofbrauhaus. There also seemed to be some confusion amongst the waitstaff as to what was going on in the Biergarten and terrace. We wanted to sit outside and still hear the music. The hostess said we could sit on the terrace and listen to the music through the speakers when the game was over. Or we could go to the Biergarten and listen to the outdoor band that was starting soon. She told us that the Biergarten was seat yourself but full-service. We opted for the Biergarten.  We found a table and sat for about 10 minutes until someone came to give us menus. The waiter gave us an Oktoberfest Biergarten menu which was just limited selections from the regular menu, this was the only menu that were were allowed to order from. Whatever reasons they have for only offering this limited menu, I'm sure they are logical, but the hostess should have told us that in the beginning. So we had to leave the Biergarten and go back up to the hostess and wait in line to get a seat on the terrace. Meanwhile, there was no band playing outside for our whole meal.  All this for an experience that didn't even feel out of the ordinary considering we had come specifically for Oktoberfest. I would suggest that the hostess disclose that the Biergarten menu is extremely limited in comparison to their regular menu. For Oktoberfest they should either have more bands or publish a schedule. And please don't play the game on TV and over the speakers, especially not during Oktoberfest.  My final critique is that they scheduled what seemed to be a wedding reception at literally the busiest time of the day. If you know you are doing this event, why allow another event to be planned on top of it?!  They need some better organization and logistical planning. The food was good, so 5 stars for that. But zero stars for Oktoberfest, as I wouldn't even call it a fest of any kind.

-WGoyzbmXZXynUT5rUeiqQ.text: Love coming to this place. Smaller chain as in not many around but a good replica of the one in Germany in style. It's a fun atmosphere for all ages. ng8oX9rQ_q_0nk93DTARAg.text: Great place for German food - I haven't had it for years since I was in Germany almost a decade ago. And it is just as good as I remember it to be. Except in Germany neither me nor our waiter spoke the same language so our group ended up getting a pretzel that we thought initially was a free appetizer. Oh, and the pretzel there only had a side of mustard.  Here, you can get your pretzel with cream cheese and cheese dip along with mustard (Giant Pretzel Combo), and it isn't that expensive. It may be a little bit salty so be ready to take off some of the salt on the pretzel.  We also ordered the Schmankerlplatte, a Bavarian sampler plate that came with Schweinebraten, Schnitzel Wiener Art, and three kinds of Wursts (along with mashed potatoes, fried cabbage, and sauerkraut). Food was very impressive except for the Schnitzel Wiener Art, a chicken dish, which was slightly dry.   Service here is fast and the beer is great! The ambience really gives a German vibe, and it's a great place to bring friends for a night of drinking and feasting. All I would need is to replace the water with sparkling water and I feel like I would be back in Germany again.

u4vsYfrSEdtKu0tyNT-O0A.text: Had a lovely evening at Hofbrauhaus on a mini-getaway! It was a Thursday night and we opted to sit in the outdoor patio area upstairs - which provided a great view of the river.  My date ordered a liter of whatever their main dark beer is, and I opted for a half liter of the lighter lager. Both were great accompaniments to our meals, and totally added to the (kind of corny) Beerhall environment. Female servers wear German costumes, but males just wear pants and polos as opposed to lederhosen or some other kind of "garb" - which my date and I both noticed and found questionable at best.  The food was mostly great, but please learn from my mistakes and don't go too wild on the beer cheese! I ordered beer cheese spatzle as a side, a risk that simply did not pay off. I think it's their version of Mac and cheese, but the cheese coagulates really fast and it more or less tasteless with a filmy texture. My schnitzel sandwich was epic and my date really enjoyed his pork entree and all of the sides, minus the sauerkraut.  Overall - this is a really great spot for a group hangout or family meetup.

ZDv7q329W367MBi0lyCU1w.text: Hofbrahaus is a great place to hang out on a cloudy afternoon and chat with friends!  I had been here once before back in 2011 and enjoyed by time, but in all the subsequent visits to Pittsburgh, never made it back although I ran by it several times when running the trails along the river.  When visiting Pittsburgh recently, Yelp friend Eileen S suggested getting together and mentioned Hofbrauhaus as a possible location and I thought that was a great idea!    We were lucky enough to get a patio seat outside.  It looked like it might rain so we were happy to be there rather than in the beer garden.   It was a very relaxing dining experience, with the mild breeze and the sounds of the accordion player inside creating a mellow back drop to the afternoon.    Service was friendly, but maybe a tad too leisurely, but since we were not in a rush it wasn't a problem.   I really enjoyed the Key Lime Lager I had.  It was light with just a hint of lime.   We all shared a huge pretzel that came with beer cheese and mustard.  When I saw it, I thought we'd never finish it but three of us were able to devour it pretty quickly!  My better half and I split a schnitzel sandwich and it was awesome.  Also plenty for two people!  It was so nice just to be able to chat and have a nice conversation while watching the river go by.  I know inside it gets very loud at the communal tables, which is also fun, but sometimes a more mellow experience is better and in this case, it really was a great way to spend a couple of hours on a Saturday afternoon.  I'll definitely go back!

ZJu8F01L39Wh1G1bbEnf9w.text: Hofbrauhaus is an entertaining place to be on a weekend, but I have to say that when it comes to sitting outside on a Sunday evening I was completely unimpressed.   The patio has potential, and has a beautiful view of the river. However, 1/2 of the patio is self service (you have to order from the bar) and the other half is full service. We stopped here because the hostess over the phone told me that dogs were allowed, sadly enough they aren't. You are however able to tie your dog to the fence, and they can sit there looking sad at you the entire time.  The beer is unique, I get it. When I ordered the overly ginormous Dunkel to share, I was surprised when the bartender left so much foam on the top of the beer. And then I noticed that this was a little trick that seemed to be done for all the tables around us as well - clever! If you do this to all customers, all day, looks like Hofbrauhaus is really making out!   Lastly, my salmon salad was so sad. For just under $20 I received iceberg lettuce, with about a 4 oz salmon. Yes, I did like the flavor of the salmon but I left starving!

2HBHN6u78BqD8y3cUl9QWg.text: I'd love to give this place more stars, but the food is such a disappointment! Yes, the beer is authentic and GREAT!! Love the beer, but the food....that's another story.   I've been several times to the original place in Munich and it does not compare with the real thing. The shell, YES, the beer YES, the food NOPE, the irrational noise level, No!   Do yourself a favor and check out the Munich menu and compare it with the US menu (incl. the low prices in Munich). Unfortunately you will not be able to sample the differences in the food quality, but trust me, it is poor and not authentic on this side of the Atlantic. The owners in Munich should be embarrassed. No way would a Hofbrauhaus from Pittsburgh, Cincinnati, Vegas or the other places make it in Germany.  We decided each time to sit outside because of the high noise level inside and enjoyed the beer and the views. What a shame that management has no pride to deliver authentic German food.  I visited in Beijing their competitor Paulaner Brauhaus a few times, their food, beer and ambiance were on par with the Paulaner in Munich. If they can deliver, why can't the Hofbraeuhaus?

8Kg7GgFJM04aZNcN8oymMg.text: Came with a group after 9:30 on a Sunday night (kitchen closes at 9). Since the kitchen was closed, food/drink choices were limited to beer and pub snacks (nachos, chili, and pretzels with various sauces). We ended up getting a round of beers along with all three snacks. The place is definitely very big, which makes it great for groups! I would also say that it was towards the end of the night towards closing so there weren't as many people, although I can only imagine how busy it normally gets during peak afternoon/dinner time. There are a variety of beers that one can get, including the drink specials (one every month), ranging from light to dark beers (stout-like even). Overall, I had a great time eating here. The snacks were all delicious, although I would say that I especially enjoyed the sauce layered on the nachos, which made it quite tempting to pick at again and again. Great place to chill with a group of friends. Will try to come here the next time during normal hours to sample some of their entree/appetizer choices.

T8XzTFqQn-uU4W2KUFldWA.text: + delicious Bavarian fare and brews, + nice patio with a scenic view, - packed and noisy inside  If you are looking for a typical Bavarian Oktoberfest experience the Pittsburgh Hofbrauhaus branch gets very close. Despite the TV screens showing sport events the interior reminds of the original Hofbrauhaus in Munich.  Similar to the interior the menu is Bavarian and convinces with delicious brews and traditional Bavarian and Southern German fare, some of them with an American twist. Make sure you try the battered and fried Sauerkraut balls and the Hofbrau Dunkel beer!   Besides German Oktoberfest Classics the live bands are playing popular American songs to which the crowd starts dancing after their first "mass" (a liter of beer).  If you prefer a less busy atmosphere the outside patio with scenic views over Monongahela River is a great alternative during a nice summer evening.  Average price for an entree: $15, price for a "mass" (1 liter of beer): $12.  + nice location + scenic view from the large patio + good Bavarian fare and beer - noisy and packed indoors

ROF0nvX_2C3-rwIReyBWxg.text: I had lunch there today.  The pretzel sandwich was very good.  Very german atmosphere.

EnHakiF6QvZL71sxtjRpbg.text: This place was great.  I wasn't expecting the food to be good or to find much activity on a late Thursday night. I walked in (after a visit to REI) and found a seat right away.  Within 45 minutes, though, there was a big crowd, people were dancing on the tables and there was a great, fun environment. And, the food WAS delicious!

Ajfxcu-3uje44BQTQggqXA.text: Disappointing. Come here if you like extremely crowded and loud places, mediocre, heavy food, and staff that only care about their next table. This place has forgetten what it means to respect each customer's business, even those trying to enjoy a family visit - since it doesn't have to.

LG2EwXBXEWQDw3P9fxdC4g.text: I have been here several times in both warm and cool/ cold months. This is a large space that on weekends can feel very cramped.   Atmosphere - 20, 30, 40 somethings, girl vs guy ratio 2 - 4, frat house, noisy, crowded, massive, messy, spills on your favorite shirt, the majority of people arriving in groups.   Service - Again, it is like a frat house here on the weekends. So service here consists of pushing your way to the bar and sticking your money out to let them know you are ready to order. Summers here are a bit better. The outside bar, which faces the river, has easier access.   Prices - The prices are a bit on the higher side for it being in the SouthSide. Mixed drinks are around $7 and beers around $5 and up.   Food - The beer is decent here, I usually get the Hefe Weizen. I am not the biggest beer drinker so I usually switch to Cap'n and Cokes. I have never eaten here (other than a pretzel) as it is always too crowded. I think the less crowded and less rowdy afternoons are probably a better time to try out their food.   Overall - While I have never had a blast here, as I feel I am getting too old to go, I think the best time to go to the Hofbrauhaus is in the summer months. This is because you can escape the craziness of the main area (lodge?) and head to the bottom level to really enjoy some time down by the river.

Zwp3L1VU0KcYq1xX8jDfGg.text: This place just took me by surprise. The ambience was outstanding. The staff were all dressed up and really friendly. The drinks and food were good. The place is not highly priced. I would highly recommend this place for a drink. Cheers!

6iL4eEPicv-Hb0Wd1TEsfg.text: I was in town visiting some friends and they brought me to the Hofbrauhaus. It was alot of fun. It's a traditional German beer hall with the long tables, the 1 liter beer mugs, and wait staff in traditional German costume. The beer was of course great German beer made by Hofbrau and the food was excellent. I ordered a bratwurst dinner that came with mashed potatoes and sauerkraut. I thought the prices were reasonable and the service was good. We ordered pretzels for an appetizer that were perfect. The place can get loud but its expected in a German beer hall.

ijD1mEFAr7NCRf3DXsTrQg.text: Went to Hofbrauhaus for lunch as well as late night for drinks. Excellent beer, great service, and unique atmosphere. Outside seating has a pleasant view of the river. The place gets real crowded and loud as the night begins but that is to be expected.   These all sound good until we start talking about food quality. The food was sub-par for its price. If you are looking for authentic German food, you would be disappointed. Nonetheless, I'd recommend getting beer there. If you don't mind crazy crowd, stop by late night to see people singing, stomping on the tables, and getting obnoxious (or you can join the drunks). As for the food? Check out Max's Allegheny Tavern instead.

4H6oX47SBiVv5wxy1gAauQ.text: On the last night of a trip, I usually tend to go to a place that I know will have good beer.  I have been to the original Hofbrauhaus in Munich.... so it was a no-brainer that I would end up here at some point during my trip to Pittsburgh.   It was a nice night, and the sun was just about set on a nice summer day.  A seat out in the Biergarten was an easy decision.  It was nice to see the old Oktoberfest tables set out with a nice river view.   To start off, we shared the pretzels and bier kasse.  Think about that.  Okay, you got it.  It was pretty much what you think it would be.  Definitely recommend.  I ordered the schweinebraten and my wife ordered the nurnberger sausages.  Unfortunately, they were out of the schweinebraten and I went with an order of the nurnberger sausages as well.  To drink, I had their seasonal Pilsner, and my wife had the hefeweizen.  Later on, I got a dunkel as well.  Everything came on in a timely manner, and tasted pretty much like what we have enjoyed in Deutschland.  The beer, as you would expect, was right on. After dinner, we split the appel strudel, which was very good.  The restaurant was in a great location.  It was right by a riverwalk, which came in handy as we tried to walk off the great meal we just had.  So.... where's the fifth star?  The party next to us asked for mustard and was given Guldens mustard.  While that wouldn't raise an eyebrow anywhere else, this is a German place and you have to get the mustard right.  It would be akin to putting ketchup on someone's noodles at an Italian restaurant.  But all in all, it was very faithful to the original Hofbrauhaus.  Definitely try to stop by here if you have a chance.  Highly recommend!

anKrUm8c1nPo_zMcrjQePA.text: There are two very important things one needs when dining at Hofbrauhaus: 1) stretchy pants and 2) a designated driver.  The stretchy pants are for comfort after you have gorged yourself on sausages, pork, sauerkraut or any number of German delicacies.  The designated driver is for when you've drunken yourself into a stupor after one gigantic beer.  I've only been there a few times, but each time, I have a decent experience, great food and awesome beer.  Yes, I know I'm breaking my rule about corporate food, but there aren't that many locations (it's not like it's a Chili's - on every corner) so I don't count it as being too, too corporate.  I forgive because the food is actually pretty good.  My one warning is that if you're looking for a nice, quiet intimate place to dine, go elsewhere.  If it's busy, you might be seated at a table with strangers (there are booths, but not too many).  On top of that, Hofbrauhaus is loud even on its slowest afternoons and absolutely nuts on a Saturday nght.

661w74zlJoYL1rhbxc4cog.text: Went there because I've been wanting to try it for a bit now. They had a sign up that said to seat ourselves, which we did. However, we were completely ignored for a solid ten minutes before getting service. I had the sampler platter. All great food, def would recommend. I also had the litre of the hefe weizen which was an incredible beer. There was a special event on patio which seemed to have all the workers attention.

2lFang5qcohXsypsTF6qUA.text: My Wife and I had the beer sampler and the App Plater and everything was great. Our server Cydne was helpful and very friendly.

Hgbma-GvZ7ca9NWw1eQ9BQ.text: Its really good! The fries are on point. Got the pork shank. Meat was fall of the bone. Can't wait to come again and try something new!

9AlMvBRvNm6fYb5OstzXPA.text: Gotta love the liter dunkels.  The food is decent depending on what you get. I feel like the pretzels and beer cheese are a little over-hyped. The schintzel sandwich is probably my favorite thing to eat there.  The place has a live band that usually plays good sing along songs (you are encouraged to stand on the benches but please don't stand on the table)  The shotskis are a fun thing to do with a group (expensive but where else do you get to take a shot off of a ski?)  All in all a good spot to hang out and chill. Once spring/summer rolls around the outside bier garden is a great place to just relax with a liter of beer and shoot the shit with your friends.

uvSQ97y9BWI8l7nOOh9uwA.text: I've only been to Hofbrauhaus few times over the years and so far my experience has been good. Good Food .. Great Beer and attentive staff depending on what time of the day you get there.  The place it self is humongous and well placed along the river board walk. The bier garden is great during summer.  I will definitely go back again for the atmosphere and the beer but not so much for the food.

APWqi6oJdfA2A7J6qei_sQ.text: Meh.  I've experienced better.    I'm amazed by the size of this place.  Indoor hall, outdoor beer garden, inside, outside, upstairs, downstairs, lots of chairs, everywherez!  We've come here several times for big get togethers, and I think that's the best upside.  They can easily accomodate large parties, and the waitstaff does a pretty good job in keeping up.  The food itself, though, is just bleh.  I guess I'm just not into German cuisine.  I mean if Heidi Klum is the pinnacle of German beauty then Hofbrahaus is like the Janeane Garafolo of Deutschland dinners.  Then again, they do have a great selection of beer, and Germans know beer.  So put down a few of their pints, and Janeane Garafolo may just magically transform into Heidi Klum! #beergoggles

aEXiwZDuqxAxIopSAkgkPg.text: Can't say enough about how much I enjoyed the beer. The good was food but the portions were actually a little too big (one portion would have been enough for my wife and I). This is a better place for large group or family than a quiet date night, but it's fun.

Gm8pClYu6aNNZAAruPhq2Q.text: I like the Hofbrauhaus a lot.  There aren't that many of them in the world, so we're lucky to have one!  That being said, we only visit once or twice a year, usually in the fall as we're fans of their Oktoberfest brew.  The pretzels are great, and my husband had the Jagerschnitzel which he said was amazing.  I honestly don't know how these people expect you to eat a meal after a half liter of beer and two soft pretzels, so I ordered a side of beer cheese spaetzle for dinner.  It's SO GOOD!    I definitely recommend sitting in the biergarden if it's nice out--you don't have to wait, it's self seating, the service is fast and they have a full bar down there as well.  There are twinkly lights strung up between the trees, plenty of bench seating, and you get a view of the river.  Not to mention you don't have to do the chicken dance down there. :)

o2ME6I4W1fLDKMtnIyInww.text: really great place to go out with friends. Love the large tables and outside seating. Good variety of food and yummy!

UVn-wcqNrlHWEgdynDNLOA.text: What a great place!  Stayed in Pittsburgh for the weekend and ate there twice. Service was good and very helpful. The food was great and the beer was even better.  It was too hot to eat outside by the river, but inside was awesome. The atmosphere was very lively with plenty of music and singing.  I would definitely go back next time I'm in town.

Oxr9NjgeJCI4X1-LQAKLtg.text: Joe Malloy! I love that guy. This is such a great place.  About as good as the Las Vegas place.  The food is tremendous, both in flavor and quantity.  The pretzels are wonderful, with beer cheese. Schnitzel was fantastic.  I even loved the sauerkraut balls. This place has more beers than Vegas which is cool.  They have a different beer every month.  Wish I lived in the area.

uzYoIzrcrGwhnvHHEpYf8A.text: If you're looking for a quiet, romantic dinner by candlelight - well, this . . . this ain't it.  But if you're looking for scrumptious German food (bratwurst, bierwurst, currywurst, pretzels, etc.) and classic German beer in a beer hall setting with accordion music, staff in lederhosen, dancing, and lots of happy patrons you will be crazily happy!  Throw in the sizeable outdoor biergarten and a lively, picturesque river scene - and this is a really nice slice of nice!

Lc9b0Uf78De9q7_9jGPYyA.text: Stopped in here for a beer and snack after a bike ride on the first nice spring day this year. Was hoping they would have the marzen on tap since it was March. No marzen on tap, they were still serving the February beer at the end if march, my half liter had a good inch plus of head, so did every other beer I watched the bartender pour. This is a beerhouse, you'd think they would know how to pour a beer. On top if that the beer wasn't even cold, just slightly lower than room temp. The pretzels I got were about on par with those frozen soft pretzels you can buy at the grocery store. I paid $10 for the pretzels and $5 for the half liter. Penn brewery is much better than this place, if you want a good German beer house experience go there. This place is more of a German themed Applebee's, if that.

olIgznexAZFs9U2VGBp3cA.text: Probably the best restaurant and bar in Pittsburgh. There is nothing else like it, everything is authentic German themed and the food as well as their beer is delicious. The atmosphere and live music makes for a fun and entertaining time.

oSM4zZXfkQwrdlVC0pE-IQ.text: So we went with a group of friends at like 730 on a saturday night.  As expected the wait was about 45 minutes to an hour.  It wasn't too big of a deal, they texted and or called the designated cell phone when the table was ready, so we were free to roam.  After being seated, i perused their gluten free menu.  Overall, I was impressed.  I had the German sausages with sauerkraut and mashed potatoes.   Let me say, i was super skeptical because I actually don't like sauerkraut at all.  Well... I have been converted.   The food was excellent.  The sausages were moist, tender, perfectly cooked and deliciously seasoned.  The sauerkraut wasn't ridiculously sour and the potatoes were creamy clouds of goodness.

ShL70joE85Tq7a9-b6R7eA.text: This place is like some kind of candyland. It's a franchise of the famous Hofbrauhaus in Munich, Germany, and it shows - the waitresses are all dressed in traditional derndl dresses, the beers are served by the liter, the band is led by an accordion and the people stand on their seats and loudly belt out whatever words they know.  Not even the excessive crowd bothered me. Believe me, it was packed in this place. But this is one of those places where the experience is made better by the huge, rambunctious group of drinking buddies all around you. I will go back every time I visit this town.

_U5M5sLLB-HeIZRyQwm_GQ.text: There was a large group of us that went to Hofbrauhaus a week ago.  I had been there a few different times during the week or on a Friday.  This was a Saturday night and they do not take reservations on Saturday nights.  We waited approxmately two hours to get seated (eight of us).    I thought the service was great.  Our waitress was very attentive, especially with the size of our group.  I enjoyed the food, beer, and environment in the bier garden as well.  It is a great place to go with a large group.  I would definately go back to Hofbrauhaus, just not on a Saturday night so I could avoid waiting a few hours!

XUgex5FArun-OL1RiTek1A.text: I left Pittsburgh in 2009, and almost every time I come back for a visit, I find myself at Hofbrauhaus. It brings to Pittsburgh that wonderful German experience, from the delicious German sausages to the huge mugs of beer to dancing on the tables. It can be loud and rowdy, but such is the environment of a German beer house, and there are outside tables for those seeking a quieter night.   Hofbrauhaus is located at the South Side neighborhood of Pittsburgh, and the overall area is nice and clean. At the outside tables, you can kick back and enjoy your 1 liter mug while gazing lazily down the river. I would highly recommend, well, everything, but my personal favorite is the liter of Hefe Weizen. One can order the half liter, the 'little beer' as we say, but one should also be aware that such can lead to a night of ridicule and taunts.  Little beer or not, the experience is a must-try, and at the very least, Hofbrauhaus gives you great food and great beer. Have a DD ready, since one can end up drinking quite a lot here. Indeed.

YjF9Dg8JaX1_zZXlpx9iLA.text: Had a great time, good food, and great beer! Went on a Thursday and sat in the main hall. Service was a bit slow, but understandable because of how packed it was. Overall, awesome!

S_usl0DeGokAbVouDr5c-w.text: This is a weird place. I went with my brother and sister in law over Christmas and our friends didn't know they had to reserve a table beforehand. We put out name on the list and stood around drinking, singing with the band, going to the patio for those who smoked, and closed the place but never did get a table. Never ever. No table for us, so no food ordered or paid for. Just beer. I was glad they cut you off after so many beers, because one of our party had gotten her hands on an extra one after she was cut off and thrown out. (She needed to be thrown out.) But then she broke her leg out front. Crazy night, and I would've liked to try the food but won't be back. Once was enough.

mBA2kykm5-jbI62UNeu0-w.text: This place can get packed.  So be prepared to wait!  However, if the biergarten is open, make sure to check it out.  Great place to grab a beer and wait for a table to open up.  Food here is, blah.  However, that's primarily b/c I hate German food.  Pretzels w/bier cheese are quite good, and make a great appetizer.  Definitely a fun place to have a beer, if you can get a table in the main hall.

C77SCRBGNYQwFiIcAySsig.text: The beer is decent, but I can honestly say you can get higher quality German food at an Autobahn gas station than this dump. How much to want to spend on mashed potatoes?  Do like groups of rowdy bros yelling in your ear? Do you like room temperature sausages? All represented here. This is a frat boys version of Germany.

5jVWBaX12d5GAue2kIV-Dw.text: Visited 3/30/14. Had a great time. Service great Place was packed. Food was fantastic. Only disappointment was the band dressed Up in their traditional outfits playing everything But classic German hofbrauhaus music Band played to the College crowd that filled The room. More country western then anything Else. Guess the owners know they will fill The room. Would have been a 5 star except For the music

8hzpUfMvZ92whN5Nx831VQ.text: I visited this restaurant with two friends around Christmastime during the daytime on a weekend. The restaurant was not busy at all, and we had our choice of table. If you like German food, you probably will enjoy this restaurant. German food is just not my favorite. I had difficulty with finishing all of my sausages. Maybe next time I will more wisely order my food. I am not a beer drinker so did not try their beer. (Yes, why did "I" go to "this" restaurant?!) My friend said that he enjoyed his food and beer. Prices were moderate. Our waiter was nice and served us well.

EhrYN-GPDfJMYG6pB5QmbA.text: When the whole crew loves a place it is a huge win.   German food was great (Gulaschsuppe, Schnitzel, Weiss Wurst, cabbage, pierogies), local food was also good (Pittsburg Salad), and their take on other foods (nachos) were just terrific.   Did not try the beer but would go out of our way to come here for the food.

QA0P49r2QhhEQEUKWcgPkw.text: Very good restaurant with good food and beer, but it is ruined by awful wait staff. Service is very rude

LhFsVWfFaapSmkIisYcuWQ.text: I happen to love the Hofbrauhaus. I bring my family and friends here every time they come into town.   Some people like to hate on the haus because it's food isn't super authentic and it's clientele is often frat-tastic, popped collars and all. I look beyond that and see the good beer served in giant mugs, guys dressed in lederhosen playing music, and in my opinion very good food.  Beer: Hofbrauhaus only servers their own beers to you only have a choice of their 4 main beers the Lager, Light Lager, Hefeweizen, and Dunkel. They also have a different specialty beer every month so when you go back you have something different to try.  Food:  I happen to really like their food. I have had several of their dishes and have liked all of them. I have always received good service and the food quality and preparation has always been consistent.   What's not to like. You will have fun when you go here, end of story.

YjCz-OZcNbYkrI_PsR3wBQ.text: Absolutely awesome!!!!  Can't say enough positive. Service!!!! Food!!!!  Location!!!!  Love sitting on the river.

U2wKasd4Xj-ryue3v_Nq9A.text: Came to Pittsburgh for a meeting this week and had dinner and beers at the Hofbrauhaus.  Great beers, loved the German stein option, the food was really good, the long tables and bier haus is fun.  Everyone at in my group seemed to enjoy their food and beer.  We had a pretzel appetizer, it was good and so was the cheese, not sure the pretzels where homemade or store bought but they went well with the beers.  For me the best part was the atmosphere.  They had a guy playing the accordion and later a stand-up bass player.  Folks where bringing up birthday and anniversary dedications and the player jumped right in with a celebratory sing-along.  The crowd seemed to know what to do and most participated in the sing-along.  We felt real comfortable and it seemed to be full of a mixed crowd of families from seniors to the kids.  We had fun.

1lSwP-VsRRPtNIl_YTSmZQ.text: Dirndl, lederhosen and bier cheese---oh my! I visited this place on a Friday night and it was an experience. My friend forewarned me how packed this place gets but I wasn't prepared whatsoever. We got there around 7P and got a booth on the side-perfect for the people watching spectacle to come. Got the bier cheese and pretzel appetizer and I wish I could have sucked it up with a straw but inevitably it would have gone right to the booty. Plus I don't think sucking liquid cheese through a straw is socially acceptable?   Then the band started along with a Pens game playing on tv and yeah, the place was madness. I've never seen a place like this before with peeps standing up on their chairs, dancing, drinking and have a merry ole time to Neil Diamond and John Denver jams. And seeing I'm originally from FL and never got into hockey, it was an experience watching a hockey game in the Burgh. The crowd was out of control with security strategically placed throughout the hall ready to break up a fight at any moment (hooray for no crazy frat boys trying to show how ballsy they are!)  When we had to get up to use the restroom, we had to take a few minutes to plan the best route in order to avoid dancing or beer spillage.   Service was ok.....the waitress disappeared for a good while and I don't blame her. Food was good but priced a little too high. Mixed crowed with people of all ages but lots and lots of kiddies. I think it would be a fun place to go to in the summer time with the huge patio they have but other than that, it would be a one in a while kinda place for me to go to. But regardless, still a fun time. Next time, Shot-ski is on the agenda.

YZK_RZSgSHaJ1Z4kouRZEg.text: Fantastic beer, large area, boisterous crowd.  The service is decent for how incredibly crowded this place gets.  Can't comment on the food as we drank the whole night. The place gets crazy later at night, everyone was dancing on the tables. Gotta love the live music.

p0Rk_CpzPP6yNjdsKRIq2w.text: Ahhh German food. This place is the pub to be at if you're visiting Pittsburgh! On top of their phenomenal  selection of beer (and mug size) they make German food delectable! The haus is very welcoming, very authentic, and loads of fun. I definitely recommend the oktoberfest beer and any of their Schnitzel! Heck you might as well just join in the fun during the month of October! All of the appetizers they offer are quite tasty and fun to share. Group seating at the long wooden benches and tables with the occasional German toast that the whole place shouts together makes this one of my favorite places to go when I'm visiting Pittsburgh.

a1uxaoRkwixBrGWV5qAH_g.text: They had an amazing crispy pork shank dish that came with a tasty potato side and very well made sauerkraut. I love pretzels while drinking beer, so that was an amazing plus with the bier cheese dipping sauce. The "German" beer was pretty standard. It was nothing to coo over. Our waitress was sweet, but it was obvious that she was overwhelmed because she alone was waiting on about 1/3 of the outdoor seating area. This is a fun place to go drink with the pals, especially if you have a larger group to accomodate. Prost!

1kH4sltzmT9bf-m2lLuemg.text: People like to complain that the food is not the most authentic, but that is not why you go here, you go for the food, the shotski and the ambiance.  If you took time to stop complaining about how authentic the food is, you would realize that the food they have is actually pretty darned good.  I have always enjoyed their schnitzels.  The shank is very good.  THe apple desert is delicious.  And you can not beat the singing!

lfxJMZW5Pq1se-O15r-fCQ.text: Really good German style food and great beer.  But the atmosphere is what really makes this place great.  The beer garden is one of the best places in Pittsburgh on a nice summer evening.  The inside can be loud and raucous, especially on the weekends.  If you're looking for a good time, this is the place.

v6BhMXLt7T1WCOKIKuhz-Q.text: I've only been here once, but I honestly wouldn't recommend it. The wait for a table was long, the place was packed and noisy, and the atmosphere was just annoying (loud drunk people chanting 'USA', god knows why because it's not an American-themed bar).   I ordered a beer and some food, which was chicken and potatoes. Everything seemed really overpriced. When it came out, it was pretty bland and boring, except for the excitement of finding a large lump of plastic in my mashed potatoes. I alerted the wait staff who told me that the potatoes come in bags that are sliced open, and some of the cut-up plastic must have gotten into the meal. The staff were super friendly and replaced it, but it was still a bit of a let-down.  Maybe it would be nicer to go in at lunch time and have a beer and a pretzel or something. For dinner though, I definitely won't be going back.

NuKdyKbX6wJqcRAFxPgpbw.text: Ich liebe Hofbrauhaus! Seriously, I love this place. I love the beer, the food, the atmosphere, and most importantly, servers in dirndls. Even if you think you won't like German food, give it a chance. It's incredible. Prost!

Ew5dxKbwna3KUH33NX3OKw.text: Great German fare at reasonable prices! Wonderful ambiance and a great outdoor area, even in cooler weather.

9giSwnEg4RqmTEICAc-7ng.text: Good beer but average service. Warm pretzels and cheese makes a good appetizer.  We went there for lunch on Sunday, party of five: 1. Reuben Sandwich- Good, lots of meat of course 2. Grilled Chicken Sandwich- Yummy, good amount of chicken and fries were fresh and crispy 3. Baby Spinach Salad- Not so good, some of the ingredients such as caramelized onions were missing 4. Chicken Ceaser Salad- OK 5. Southside Chicken- Satisfying and vegetables were good.  Worth trying, if you like good German beer.

photos.caption: Photo of Hofbrauhaus Pittsburgh - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Dark, wheat, light

xvYuF4OXOUvyGnXMdu4Zmw.text: To be honest this is not my favorite place in Pittsburgh and I have not visited in a while-it is loud, the food/beer is not great and the German bands are annoying. On my last visit I was prepared to write a 2 star review but was surprised at the food and service.  In past visits the food has been horrible however on this visit I was pleasantly surprised how good everything tasted. We only had to wait about 15 minutes on a busy Friday night to sit in the main seating area. Our waitress was very prompt (not friendly but she was busy and quick to get our orders and food). I started with the large glass of the wheat beer.  This is not my favorite place for beer and it is just your average German wheat beer.  We went with the pretzels and beer cheese as our starter. I have had bad experiences with the beer cheese tasting like paste but this time it surprised me and was delicious.  For my entree I ordered the club sandwich. I changed a few things on it and they had no problem getting my order straight. I choose the mashed potatoes as my side which were equally as tasty.  All in all a great place to have a drink on a Friday night with friends but eat before you come.

g8xRzyrmeyCMysXXL2gNeA.text: I don't know if it was the timing or what, but we had a great experience here. I got the Schweineshaxe (a favorite German food of mine) and it was absolutely amazing. Even people walking by our table to theirs asked what it was so they could order it. Fantastic.  Of course the beers were good too, and the view on the deck made for great atmosphere. The waitress had no problem with our taking time to eat our meal and have a few beers, and we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves.

0f1d_nwJ7aSiy46Q1kagaA.text: We came here on a Sunday night for a late dinner so it wasn't very crowded. There was a guy on stage singing most of the time we were there. He sang both German and cover songs. We started off with beers and the Oktoberfest pretzel - it was so good and I liked the different sauces that came with it. How do you top soft pretzels and beer? With giant pretzels and liters of beer.. can't go wrong with that combination. For dinner, I had the jagerschnitzel - pork cutlet topped with burgundy wine mushroom and bacon sauce and my boyfriend had the wiener schnitzel - similar to what I had minus the sauce. Both were really good and big portions.   Wish we could've seen what it was like here on a Friday or Saturday night.

2qvPJtwjNkc7c7XaZNfMNQ.text: Hofbrauhaus is just so much fun!  Absolutely LOVE the drinking atmosphere. The grand tables, the ginormous "dining hall" (or drinking hall?), the lovely covered terrace - it's all great!  I came here for dinner last night and enjoyed a couple brews (I think I had the one for October? They have a different beer every month! AMAZING). I started with the pretzels and biercheese and ordered the spatzle with chicken and mushrooms. The biercheese was definitely the highlight of the meal - fresh homemade pretzels and a light (but still rich) cheddar beer dip. I literally have a craving for these at least once a week!  The spatzle was pretty good, but nothing exciting. For those of you like me who have never really eaten German food before, spatzle is a dense, egg noodle that vaguely resembles gnocchi. The Heidelberger Rahm Spatzle (what I got) consisted of chicken breast, marsala cream sauce, caramelized onions, and mushrooms. My boyfriend got the Kasespatzle (like a mac 'n' cheese) and that was super rich, but very tasty. I'd recommend splitting that one.  Service and atmosphere were great, food wasn't bad. I'd definitely come here again for a round or two and some biercheese!

keTlaXcHDVj5WgNuFCml8Q.text: awesome place. came here on saturday for lunch and sat on the outdoor covered porch. you have a view of the river, you are outside but shaded from the sun, what more could you ask for?   i had a few random sides....potato pancake and spaetzle with beer cheese. DH had pork medallions with sauerkraut and mashed potato. all were amazing!!! DH had a beer flight and absolutely loved the maibock. he raved about it all afternoon.   servers were friendly. indoors in the beer hall they had live music of traditional oktoberfest tunes.  highly recommend this place!

vpexooWrm9sIp0GnOTVBKw.text: I had high expectations for the hofbrauhaus after reading good reviews on Yelp, but I wasn't impressed with the sampler appetizers. The pretzels were very ordinary pretzels you can find in the freezer aisle. The "meatloaf" was bologna slices. The biercheese wasn't much more than nacho cheese. The beer was great though.   The atmosphere on a Wednesday night was very quiet and uneventful. But the place looks like it could be really fun during the weekend when there are more people.

Ucf74_Rmq-03UAaehRZZQg.text: Everything about  hof brau was fantastic.   Atmosphere, great outside seating.   Even inside is a cool experience - was their during the World Cup and it was a blast. Brat, sauerkraut, potato pancakes - everything we ordered was bring home good.  Beers were cold and fresh out of the barrel.   Can't wait to go back.

CsgAtDRpAmXE76mYZ9bxGw.text: Great spot on the Mon!  Excellent beer and food. We are regulars here and service has consistently been very good. Check out the steinmaster club and get your own locker. Pork Porterhouse and Schnitzels are the way to go!

eZPnTG89G5kqicwqaYIaew.text: Ahhhh I love this place!! Definitely a must if you're visiting Pittsburgh or a resident! The beer serving are huge!!! I was having a pretty good time after the first huge glass! And those soft pretzels are to die for!   We sat on the patio, such a beautiful view out there! Love the atmosphere and how freaking big the place is! Definitely perfect for big groups of people! Great if you actually want to go out and have conversation with people.   I also saw a lot of families in there so it looks like it can be enjoyable for almost everyone (maybe not young children)! Highly recommend!

bAsuYUVRebdUPLcNJgSpeA.text: We had a wonderful time at Hofbrauhaus when visiting some friend's to celebrate some birthdays. We really wanted to go there because we are planning to go to Oktoberfest this year, and what a better place to prepare than the Hofbrauhaus, right? It was so much fun!  We weren't able to get a table in the main room at first so we went to the side room where we got some appetizers, and a few people got meals. I enjoyed looking over the menu at some of the traditional German dishes. If you are not a fan of German food, then don't expect to like their food. I rather enjoyed the things I tried - including the weiner schnitzel, the kraut balls, and the pretzels.   The beer was really good too and pretty cheap. I tried the Premium Lager, the Hefe Weizen, and the Dunkel. I liked the Premium the best, but the others were good too. You got a ton of beer for the cost, and I was even able to buy the stein for an extra $10 to add to my beer boots and steins collection.   We also enjoyed doing some shot skis, where we all lined up and downed a shot together. One of my friends was the short one on her ski and got a shot in her eye - so just make sure the taller folks bend down a bit! It was pretty funny though.   Once the main room opened up a bit, we headed over there to dance on the tables and cheers each other with our steins. It was a really fun night, and I would definitely recommend a trip there if you are into Oktoberfest-type or binge-drinking activities. Fun times indeed!!

dgZLzQXN7vitqEG9rngi8g.text: Soo I definitely wasn't expecting the whole Oktoberfest feel when I went in there. This is the first thing I did when entering Pittsburgh.  There was live music and the whole place was buzzing. I loved every second of it and the food was great. The Hefeweizen might have been the best I have ever had and the Bier Cheese served with soft pretzels was fantastic!! Highly recommend to anyone who wants some authentic German cuisine or is looking for a fun atmosphere with their meal.

6x1sHUaBqqZr02kuW6aC1w.text: This is a must stop if in Pittsburgh.  Great pretzel, plenty of beer to choose from.  The only thing I wasn't able to do was go here on a weekend night.  I was there on a Monday before a Pirates game.  Not many people there.  Great location, right on the water.  Friendly staff.  Seats 800 and I was told they get to standing room only on the weekends.

u5lwHPijnFBt3zYo7Sj2uA.text: Went here for the first time yesterday instead of Max's on North Side.  The open dining area felt like an authentic German hall sort of thing -- kind of like what I would imagine the German hall at Busch Gardens in Williamsburg would be like.    Service was pretty good.  For an appetizer, we got pretzels and bier cheese.  It was pretty tasty, but the bier cheese was kind of dry and stuck to the roof of my mouth (but it was totally worth it).  Ordered the schnitzel cordon bleu, which is fried veal, ham, and bier cheese on top, and for sides I substituted with a potato pancake and sauerkraut.  The food was really good and fresh, although the bier cheese was still pretty dry (maybe that's how it's supposed to be, I don't know.)  Overall, I had a pretty good experience here at the Hofbrauhaus, although I would still choose Max's over it.

0Z0EfsWh7kfdw2ee8frDjg.text: Mmmm......pretzels and.bier cheese [said in a Homer Simpson voice].  And of course the beer and environment are incredible.  Sitting outside on the river celebrating the start of Oktoberfest.

gBCAlxnXaGhRZlH-13QKaQ.text: How did I miss this place. It's is much like Munich and is a close as you can get to an Octoberfest celebration this side of the pond. Good German food and good service. Last night they had open seating which was fun for us and we got a chance to share a table with some folks who were a blast. We ate and a German band was setting up in traditional garb. They had two accordions in the band and I figured we were in for an evening of traditional German beer hall music - I was way wrong. These old guys were doing cover songs! Great sing along songs which were great. If you just want to sit and eat quietly don't sit in the main hall. In a few minutes everyone was standing on their chairs singing and dancing. It was a blast. Oh and the beer - great German variety and it was excellent.

uW0Kj-oESfgpE-CmpHL0yg.text: I wish, I wish, I wish we had one of these in St. Louis.  First, apparently this is actually a replica version of the actually Hofbrauhaus that they have in Germany (so my friend who actually went said). So. Pretty cool on that front. Thankfully, there aren't drains in the floor of this one like there are for the one in Germany...  They're a German beer hall so so course you have to get the beer steins. They're pretty big. Each stein is probably about 2.5 cans of beer.   The food is decent. The pretzels with cheese are actually really good. Get them. I also got a plate of spatzle with chicken breast, and like everything else here, the plate was huge. I finished it all but I don't know how I did it and I kind of wished I hadn't. Later, we got the ski shots, which are basically just 4 shots on a ski and you have to drink it all at the same time.  The atmosphere in the beer hall: you either love it or hate it. It's rowdy. It's loud. There's people standing on benches. (Surprise revelation of the night: Sweet Home Alabama is apparently a popular song in Pittsburgh.) They do have a great beer garden outside for when the weather is nice and you just want to get it away from all the ruckus inside.  For dessert, we had the apfel strudel and the chocolate layer cake. I really liked the chocolate layer cake though it was at the point in the night when I probably could have cared less what was for dessert.

RCjfgNRSJBBvgU_Hdo29gw.text: The food was very good . The service was good too. I couldn't believe how cheap the beer was.  My boyfriend and i had some sort of German chilly fries which was really good.  We also had the giant pretzel.  So good.

r416TwegkQFe2jBu29svrA.text: Went here on a Tuesday night after Germany beat Brazil in a 2014 World Cup match.  The night was very comfortable so we sat outside along the river.  We had the Hofbrau Hefe Weizen beer, the Bavarian Jagerschnitzel and a Dunkel Bourbon Chicken Sandwich.  All were excellent.  The service was efficient and attentive.  My son who is attending school in Pittsburgh said he was definitely coming back with his friends.  The price seemed very reasonable less than $90 for three.

hOHOo2-9t0OcSekDiKGYiA.text: Ok so I gave this place five stars based on it's atmosphere and it's unique look inside and outside the building. Also for its awesome beer selection. The food is mediocre at best at least that's my opinion. They have a band here at night and its located in a very nice and safe area which is in the South Side Works of Pittsburgh.
